Reviews.Title: “Baseball Right Outside My Window”
Reviews.Author: DK L
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised to find this hotel. I'll be back during baseball season. The location right next to Safeco Field and Pyramid Brewery was a perfect fit for me! I slept well and appreciated the HUGE bathtub for my tired neck and back. I slept well, waking up refreshed and ready for a day of work in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great again”
Reviews.Author: mazzieg
Reviews.Content: Second stay and again great. We go to Seattle for the baseball and there is no better hotel for this purpose! Glance out your window and there is the ball park - how much better can it get! We enjoy the restaurant, reasonable prices and really friendly staff - hotel staff also very friendly. Okay gym, laundry facilities very welcome for overseas travellers! An easy walk to downtown if you're interested (we are in our forties) but it isn't just next door, as noted in other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected delight”
Reviews.Author: Flosschick
Reviews.Content: I booked an unpublished room in the Seattle Pike's Place area and was slightly disappointed to get the same place for the second time. I didn't remember having any complaints about this hotel other than the location being further away from the market than I would have liked and the daily parking rate seemed kind of steep. BUT... This time I felt compelled to write a review. The front desk surprised us by upgrading our room and they didn't even know it was our anniversary. We walked in to a beautiful and well appointed jacuzzi room with a view of the water, down town and The Space Needle to the North. We utilized the free shuttle. The driver was very curteous, friendly and helpful with a good recommendation on where to dine. We also visited the brewery across the street and had excellent service there. We were pleasantly surprised once again when we checked out the outdoor roof top pool and jacuzzi. Fabulous! As if all this weren't enough, the next morning we asked for a late check out and they allowed us to stay until 2 PM! Thank you Silver Cloud, I wouldn't hesitate paying full price for this kind of treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great onsite restaurant”
Reviews.Author: IanC67
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised by this hotel. Having read previous reviews I was aware of the location away from the city center and near to Safeco fields. The journey to the hotel from the airport was somewhat interesting as it appears sometimes that we are in a dock-yard and about to drive into the sea. However immediate vicinity of the hotel is fine. Check in was quick, friendly and efficient; I was in my room in minutes. The standard rooms are modern, clean and spacious. I didn't have time to use the pool or gym (nor would I use the outside pool as it was cold and raining) but the pool did look nice. The onsite restaurant was very good with good quality food (including a few vegetarian options) and very friendly service. I ate my evening meal and also took breakfast at the restaurant. The only downside is out of the control of the hotel; the noise of trains and ships can be loud during the night. Check out was also quick and efficient. A good stay - I would certainly return if business takes me back to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly good; but, be aware of its remote location!”
Reviews.Author: TraveljohnsonJ
Reviews.Content: What a surprise this hotel proved to be. It is high in design and the guest rooms offer great comfort and amenities. Unfortunately, if you are expecting Pike Place to be easily accessible, along with shopping in the central business district, you will be staying at the wrong hotel. But do keep in mind this hotel offers complimentary van service to the heart of the business district and Pike Place between 7 AM and 11 PM; however, it operated only every 30 minutes. If you are in Seattle for a sporting event at one of the two adjacent stadiums, you will be in knocking on the gates to heaven! Rest assured, during non sporting event times, this hotel must offer great rates to attract customers. In complete honesty, this hotel is of better quality than most located in downtown Seattle. However, I just did not want to be in this remote location, and without a car, what we saved on our room by not staying in the central district was quickly gobbled up by taxi fares.

Reviews.Title: “Outside of downtown but great stay”
Reviews.Author: canadiana1ca
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a Priceline stay at the Silver Cloud Stadium. Yes - as per previous review - this is considered "downtown" but it is definitely outside the downtown area being right across the street from Safeco Fields. For my girlfriends weekend away - it would've been nice to be in the Pike Street area but Silver Cloud has a fantastic shuttle. We got the shuttle at 9am and it dropped us off right at Pike Place Market. We shopped all day, had a massage and a fantastic dinner at Purple Cafe. After dinner we called the shuttle and it picked us up right outside the restaurant. The shuttle goes ANYWHERE in a designated zone and you don't have to walk to certain spot - it'll pick you up right outside where you are. The shuttle driver on Sat night (Feb 18th) - I wish I got his name - was such a great guy. Chatted and made jokes about the # of bags we had. The hotel is in the night club/bar area of town so there are some seedy guys but if you walk past them, they don't bother you. We easily walked to the waterfront for dinner and back. The hotel is clean with a safe in the room and beds were extremely comfortable. Love the blackout curtains as we really needed to sleep in on Sunday! Front desk staff was also really great. When we checked out Sunday the lady took our valet receipt and got the guys to bring out the car while we were checking out so we barely had to wait for our car. Good job on the customer service. This is the reason for my 5 star review Thanks for a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Good for exploring downtown”
Reviews.Author: macntoes
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of our tropical vacation in Belize. The room was spacious and very clean and a nice change from the smaller condo we stayed in for two weeks prior. Service was good, however their shuttle service does not take you to and from the airport (we arrived very late and it would have been nice to not have to spring for a cab, but it is pretty far away) and their food and shuttle service doesn't start until 7 AM so if you have to catch a ferry before that, you need to plan ahead and get food the night before or plan to take a taxi somewhere else. The area doesn't seem that bad at night but you should consider that there really isn't anywhere to just walk to for a bite to eat except the on-site restaurant. We booked this hotel through hotwire and paid $115/night and we probably wouldn't pay more than that for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for convetion and ball game”
Reviews.Author: rjmkrieger
Reviews.Content: Service was great and taking advantage of the courtesy shuttle was a great move to get around town. If you like being across the street from stadiums, this was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Silver Cloud”
Reviews.Author: mrbakery
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at this hotel . It will not be our last . Great Location with a exceptional staff made this stay perfect .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rivergirl1pr
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean rooms, comfy beds. The free shuttle was great, dropped us off for dinner and picked us up when done. Jimmy's on First didn't have the greatest food. Not really within walking distance if very much. Would have to walk through Pioneer Square to get anywhere which is a bit sketchy, but overall a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Seattle Stay”
Reviews.Author: Krayche
Reviews.Content: Great location (especially if you want to see a baseball game, it's right across the street) just outside the heart of downtown but close enough to take the free shuttle and be there fast. Got a great deal on Priceline but even the regular price seemed good considering the location (Seattle is an expensive town) and the well appointed very clean rooms with comfy mattress. Was worried about the huge bright LCD ads on the stadium right across from the room keeping us up but the curtains blocked the light completely. Very friendly front desk staff. We parked on the street cuz I'm cheap and it's free evenings and Sundays, but they do have secure valet parking. I'll definitely stay again and have recommended to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: rsindelar
Reviews.Content: This was an absolutely wonderful hotel! Got a great last minute deal online, and for the money paid I cannot find a thing to complain about. The hotel is a bit of a walk from the major downtown attractions, but they offer a free shuttle every 30 minutes so the distance is not a problem at all! Every member of the staff we encountered was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was very nicely decorated and quite large. The bed was AMAZING! So comfortable! Definitely would reccomend this hotel if you are in the Seattle area!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: barkerd
Reviews.Content: I expected a dried up hotel on the wrong end of town, only I found a newer building that was very inviting. The valet was ready to assist with bags and car. The desk staff was very sharp and greeted you upon arrival. The lobby is immaculate and comfortable. A room key is required to use the elevator. Our room is very large with two queen beds, desk, chest and reading chair. The bathrooms were very sharp and clean. jimmy's restaurant was great for dinner and breakfast. Being a bit off the downtown, the hotel provides shuttle service around the downtown area. It still costs a whopping $22 bucks a day to park. oh well, a great hotel in an okay part of town. Well worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: mdb9779
Reviews.Content: The hotel meets all of the basic needs. If it was during a game, I could see it being too busy. I did have to take my luggage up and the cart set outside my door for more than a day. The gym is really small. Luckily no one else was there or it would have been too crowded. You really have to know how to use the heat or the room would have been too cold.the thermostat looked fairly easy but it would get stuck on different settings (I just kept hitting buttons until it worked right). There is a mini fridge and sink in the room, a mini-bar - which is nice for the extra counter space. Housekeeping was good. The foo in the restaurant was good and staff friendly. I prefered not being directly in downtown too, but on the southern edge. I had a car too, but could see if you werent 'street smart', you probably wouldn't walk into downtown. I got a parking ticket in downtown (obviously not impacting this review), but with where you park. Parking is expensive, but a $55 ticket costs more. Overall the hotel met my needs.

Reviews.Title: “right beside Safeco Field!”
Reviews.Author: happy c
Reviews.Content: We went to a Mariners game in the summer and stayed here. Prices are pretty steep (about 200/night for double queen room) but the rooms are nice and the location is sweet. We got totally stuck in traffic going to the motel because of everyone going to the game and that sucked but no fault of the hotel, just something for people to keep in mind. There is a roof-top pool which we were super looking forward to. It is pretty small and was crowded which changed the experience but still a total bonus. We had dinner downstairs at Jimmy's - the place was totally hopping on game day so service was a little slow but experience overall was good. Fresh apples in the lobby, lots of room to hang out in the lobby. Staff were nice. Parking was extra but secure. It literally took us two minutes to get back in our rooms after the game. We will stay here again but not every time we come down since it really is above our price range as a family, once you factor in the baseball game, food etc. Still, a great choice overall.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SPOT ESP FOR SPORTS FANS!”
Reviews.Author: the12thmanseattle
Reviews.Content: this place is great. the staff is really nice, the rooms are clean and newer, they all have a sink and refridgerator. the bathroom is huge, and if you're in town for a game this hotel is directly across the street from both stadiums (for seahawks and mariners games). it will literaly take you 30 seconds to walk to the gate of the stadium!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Christmas”
Reviews.Author: Snoopy218
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the BEST in Seattle. We stayed her Dec 23rd to 26th and the staff were the BEST. From the manager before we even stayed here to the front desk staff to the restaurant staff this hotel goes above and beyond. Jeska at the Front deak and David the shuttle driver truly made our Christmas one of the best. We WILL be back. Beds are comfy rooms are spacious with large tvs. Hot tub on the roof with a view of the bayt is outstanding. Staff, Staff, Staff makes the biggest dffedrence friendly efficient and wanting to please you.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: KahunaRegina
Reviews.Content: A number of us went to Seattle for the Seahawks Game Monday Dec.12 2011. We stayed at the Silvercloud for 5 nights. We found the hotel to be clean and the staff very helpful. The location is fantastic for football games and baseball games. The rates were resonable and the lounge and resturant good. The suttle service to to wharf was a great addition to our stay. We would recommend this hotel highly

Reviews.Title: “Speechless”
Reviews.Author: travelerboy101
Reviews.Content: I am literally speechless! This hotel and all of the other hotels in its chain are probably one of the best. I stayed in the 1 bedroom suite and it was amazing! I really don't think I needed the kitchenette but it was a good touch. The bathroom had two showers which I didn't need but it was nice to have a very deep tub to soak in after roaming around the cold city. The staff was also very nice and helpful. Jimmy's on First in the lobby has very good food, especially for breakfast. The location is very good especially if you have a game to go to! It is walking distance from both stadiums, Safeco and Qwest! If you have a game planned or your just going to explore the city stay here!

Reviews.Title: “I love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: polsongrizz
Reviews.Content: If in town for a game MLS, NFL or MLB this is the place to stay. A whole two min walk to your game. A great bar downstairs where we partied with Hope Solo before a game. Lots of other great bars and breweries within five min of the hotel. Back to the hotel, for the price one of the best deals in town. Great service, rooms and more to the point an awesome comfortable bed, yes.

Reviews.Title: “2.5 star posing as a 3.5 star”
Reviews.Author: Salina M
Reviews.Content: this hotel is definitely NOT a 3.5 star hotel. it's more like a 2.5 star hotel posing at a 3.5 star. it is not in a nice part of downtown, it's about 8 minute drive to the nice part. you cannot walk to it. you cannot walk in the area period, there's no restaurants within walking distance either and the staff is immature and unprofessional. there was hair on our pillowcase and once we uncovered the top comforter off the bed, the sheets were not tucked in and crisp at all, they barely made the bed and the sheets did not smell clean. there was a stain on the sofa chair. to top it off there was a gentleman checking in with a prostitute. it was obvious from her appearance he had picked her up from the side of the road. she was groping him right in the lobby at the front desk - ew! it made me wonder what kind of things go on in this hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Charged Behind our Backs”
Reviews.Author: sonjlaf
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for game day. Getting to underground parking was a labryinth of road blocks. I suspect because it was so crowded, the staff ran out of smiling hospitality. The biggest kick in the butt was the $287 non authorized fee on credit card, accusing us of smoking in the room(we are non smokers, just lit an incense stick in the bathroom). We will not return here.

Reviews.Title: “Train Station Near by”
Reviews.Author: Marin1
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Thanksgiving Day at this hotel, was easy to check in, had a nice feel, and also spa like smell. my only complaint was the train whistle it seemed every few hours that woke me up, also the thermostat did not seem to work correctly, there was no spare blankets and I was to tired to call for an extra blanket, the room did heat up in the morning, I see that another reviewer also had similar complaints about the heating system. It would have been nice to be comped a discount on breakfast which I asked for but the manager needed to approve it. I did like the layout of the room, and spacious bathroom. it was a good walk to the downtown area, but we enjoy walking so that was also nice. also liked the free wifi. the restaurant connected to the hotel was good. we were the only ones eating breakfast and had great service. I gave the review 4 stars because of the friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “2.5 Star masquerading as a 3.5 star”
Reviews.Author: acanadiandave
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was small and dark, with a peekaboo view of the hospital on the hill. On gameday it is loud and very difficult to even enter the hotel for parking. Staff were efficient but not friendly. Off the beaten path and not much in the area other than the stadiums and some pubs that cater to sports fans. Our visit was marred by being summarily charged a $250 'smoking' fee (we are non-smokers) for lighting an incense stick in the bathroom. I would not recommend this hotel; Silver Cloud Broadway is much nicer (and cheaper).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Sarah M
Reviews.Content: We had never heard of this chain since we are from Toronto, but booked the hotel through Hotwire.com. The lottery process with Hotwire is somewhat daunting, but alas we came out a WINNER with the Silver Cloud Hotel Stadium. We arrived on our connecting flight from Vancouver at 1pm Pacific and took a cab to the hotel. It is located in a sort of industrial area, but it was a great place if you don't want to stay in the hustle and bustle of downtown. The lobby is beautiful with lots of cozy chairs and couches, fireplaces and big screen tvs (it was truly a lounge worthy lobby!) Our check it was fast and we were even upgraded to a King bed for free. Nice! This hotel is about a 5-10 minute cab ride outside of downtown but they do offer a FREE shuttle instead! We never got to use it ourselves, but make sure you reserve space early--at peak times, it does fill up fast! Our room was a nice king bed (very cozy!) in room 938 (for all you baseball fans, this has a great view of Safeco Field where the Seattle Mariners play.) The rooms looks like they have been updated with marble counter tops in the bathroom and wet bar area. It was surprising to have a wet bar in the room, but it was very nice. There was the standard coffee maker but also a microwave and mini fridge which is great if you want to re-heat leftovers from a meal you couldn't finish or keep some drinks cold. Please note that there are ice machines on every floor EXCEPT the 9th, so we had to go down 1 floor to get ice. This was a non issue. Just down the hall is the rooftop pool and hot tub (which we didn't use because it was November.) Here's a little secret, even if you don't want to swim, go to the pool deck and just around the corner is a KILLER view of Seattle! It makes for great photo opportunities. We tried the restaurant (Jimmy's on First) and it was delicious and well priced for such large portions. Overall, our stay was short and sweet, but this lovely small chain hotel made such a great impression that we will be sure to book this hotel on our next stay in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great room at great price”
Reviews.Author: kate040
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little off the beaten track of downtown Seattle - around the sports arenas. It has really great rooms with luxury amenities, free wi-fi, large flat-screened tv...was a really great room. My only negative is that there are few places to eat within walking distance and the restaurant was not good. I ordered a cup of clam chowder that was a puree. I did it through hotwire on a night without sports events and got a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place to stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Dalynn B
Reviews.Content: I absolutly love this hotel. The front desk staff is very friendly and accomadating. I stay at this hotel every time I am in Seattle and I have no complaints. The rates tend to be a little higher than other properties in the area, but the excellent service is totally worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel chain with great amenities for a good price!”
Reviews.Author: Adam_5703
Reviews.Content: If you've never been to a Silver Cloud, they are a great regional hotel chain with many features that make us come back to visit again and again. We've stayed at Silver Cloud on Broadway several times and now this one - both are excellent. PROS: -Room amenities (microwave, mini fridge, safe, ipod dock in the alarm clock, HDTV - and this is a standard room); -Good facilities (rooftop pool and Jacuzzi); -Nice restaurant and bar (we had the grilled cheese and the burger - Mmm mmm GOOD food); -Reasonable prices (we got it for $85/night for a weekend on a hotel bidding site); -Location (easy drive or taxi to anywhere in downtown Seattle, walk to sports stadiums and only 15 mins drive to Bellevue); -Free shuttle! (runs twice hourly from hotel and pickups scheduled on demand); -Reasonably priced parking ($22/nt for valet in downtown Seattle); -Free wi-fi; -Free local phone calls; -Staff are always friendly and helpful (for example, the bar staff changed one of the TVs to a hockey game we wanted to watch on request, the room service brought us corkscrew and wine glasses free of charge, the front desk provided directions and a visitor map without being asked, etc); -As a gay couple we have always found this hotel chain very gay-friendly / respectful. CONS: -Some of the other little touches were missing - no minibar, no bottled water in the room; -the Stadium area is a bit industrial - not the best place for a walk after dark; -the wi-fi was a little slow at times (but hey, it was FREE and there's also a FREE business centre with computers and internet access that's faster); -the beds are totally comfortable but they're just not quite as good as Marriott, Sheraton or Westin beds (those ones are just fantastic)... on the other hand, this hotel is priced better; -Room service ends at 11:00pm.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great choice for those who drive”
Reviews.Author: dougers79
Reviews.Content: This hotel was literally like day and night. During the day the staff is helpful, kind and ready to assist you with anything. At night it is a whole different story...staff is short, rude and unavailable. My biggest issue was with the valet parking. I always prefer self parking but this wasn't an option as they don't allow self parking. I called down to have my car ready and noone answered. I waited and called again...no answer. The front desk tracked down a valet attendant so I could have my car...and almost missed a dinner reservation. We used the shuttle service once and it was good. We ate at Jimmys for lunch when we arrived and it was great as well. I will not stay at this hotel in the future but I could see where the location would be good for some and for those who are not relying on a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; clean and can't beat the location for pro sports events”
Reviews.Author: YakimaClan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located west of the Seahawks stadium and north of the Mariners stadium. Can't beat the location if you are attending a sporting event at either venue. Beware, tho, that both the bar and restaurant were packed before a recent Sounders FC game (of course, most restaurants surrounding the stadium are usually packed before game time). My room was very clean and modern-looking; loved the flat screen high-def TV. I stayed in a room on the 7th floor that overlooked the inner courtyard. Street noise wasn't an issue and I slept soundly. Another lame hotel "fitness center" with two treadmills, two ellipticals, and a set of free weights. To their credit, at least the equipment was modern. Never did make it to the deck to check out the pool and hot tub. Parking is valet-only, $22/night plus tax. Very friendly and polite front-desk staff. Didn't use the shuttle but other reviewers have said it's a nice feature.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel rocks!”
Reviews.Author: rangergirl73
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Hotwire and were worried a bit when we saw the fee for valet parking (the only option in this section of Seattle). The staff was super friendly, the rooms were immaculate, the hallways are decorated with welcoming and artsy colors and lighting and the hot tub on the roof with a view of the stadium was perfect after a long flight. We had the hot tub to ourselves on that chilly October day and, while there was quite a bit of noise from the street, we watched the roof close on the baseball stadium across the street. Our room was cozy and quiet- no street noise, no neighbor noise. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. The lobby was welcoming and they have a shuttle to downtown so no parking hassles await you when you tromp into the city. Thanks, Silver Cloud!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel: Good. Location: Not so good.”
Reviews.Author: Stephen H
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for a few days. The hotel itself is quite nice. Had a room on the 9th floor literally looking into Safeco field which was pretty cool. The room was clean and modern. Not quite sure I needed the in-room "kitchenette" -- sink, fridge and microwave -- or the laundry on the 8th floor, but I imagine these are useful for some travelers. And I'm certainly not complaining about additional facilities! There were no Mariners, Seahawks or Sounders games going on so the place was quiet and I was allowed to check in right away as I arrived pretty early. The restaurant in the lobby was decent -- but a little lacking in charm, maybe because it was empty. But, yeah, overall this hotel is nice. Definitely worth the $100 or so a night that I paid on Priceline. The only drawback about this place is its location -- that's why I rate it 3 instead of 4. Other than the lobby restaurant and Pyramid brew pub across the street, you're in nowheresville. Super useful, I imagine, if you're in town for one day just to see a game. I'm a single guy who enjoys a good healthy walk and doesn't mind slightly gritty parts of town -- but my 70-year old parents would find this location inconvenient and a little sketchy. On the other hand, they might use the free shuttle bus, but that's no my style. It's a fairly bleak 10 minute walk to get from the hotel to Pioneer Square -- although there are one or two interesting old bars along the way. From the airport, the light rail is pretty convenient, although the 10 minute walk from the station to the hotel is a little tough to navigate -- again, something my parents just wouldn't do. Bottomline: Good hotel. But the location is what it is. If you can work with a slightly desolate location which involves either a lot of walking or relying on a shuttle bus.

Reviews.Title: “Beat expectations”
Reviews.Author: CDR-PI
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights this week. Were skeptical about location until we served. Wonderful staff, free shuttle downtown and to ferry. Helpful staff. We illmstay here again. Dining was average but we did not really eat much.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: tony_travel86
Reviews.Content: Booked the room on hotwire. Very clean hotel, great location with a free shuttle! Definitely will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “convenient to train station and Pioneer Square besides stadiums”
Reviews.Author: Barbara43323
Reviews.Content: Check in friendly and efficient. Front desk staff helpful in suggesting ways of navigating the city with public transportation. Hotel shuttle very helpful and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay at a great value!”
Reviews.Author: shaholcomb
Reviews.Content: Rooms are better than Marriott or Sheraton. Great Shuttle service with excellent drivers. Front desk and room service staff were wonderful. Really loved great air control, great beds and great 42' TV for some R & R.

Reviews.Title: “A Well Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: Creekview_al
Reviews.Content: I hesitate to recommend this location since it is already almost impossible to get a reservation when the Mariners or Seahawks have a home game. A boutique property at reasonable prices. Rooftop pool and hot tub, overlooking SAFECO stadium a winner for the kids-- and others. If your plans don't include a sports event, there are more convenient locations. Good security with room card needed to operate elevator, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hiker100
Reviews.Content: Nice modern hotel with comfortable stay. Rooms are clean with nice granite countertops in bathroom. True to hotel photos. Nice lobby and very professional and helpful front desk staff. We got the room through Priceline for a good deal compared to area hotels. Be aware hotel parking is valet for $22/night so factor that in. They are next to Safeco Field and not really walking distance to city center but they have a free shuttle which is very accomodating and can pick up or drop you off at the major sites. Only a few minutes drive Shuttle staff is very friendly and always willing to help. Only complaint is the rooftop pool and hot tub. Our swimsuits had a foul odor after visiting hot tub. Not sure if its an insufficient clorination issue. Beautiful rooftop deck nonetheless. Overall, a great find in the city. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great, for travelers without a car”
Reviews.Author: danmarc2002
Reviews.Content: This hotel is next door to Safeco field and football stadium. Also only a few blocks from Amtrack station. We stayed here on our return trip from Vancouver and walked from the amtrack station to the Silver Cloud. The hotel is very nice and has newly remodeled rooms. Our room was on the small side, but had a web bar area with a granite counter. I could not give 5 stars because the view of Seattle and the location is not great. It is near the waterfront, but in a very industrial area. On the other hand, there is a free shuttle in a very comfortable van that will pick up and drop off to any touristy area downtown. We saved so much on cabs/buses! It was like having a personal driver! Overall for the price (we got it on priceline), it was worth it. The pool is on the roof and the view from there is not great, but if you are looking for a clean, comfortable place to stay without spending a small fortune, I would definetly recommend it. The service was tops! The restaurant had great burgers! I think during baseball and football games, the prices at this hotel may be higher.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bradwall13
Reviews.Content: we stayed 2 nights at the hotel, the staff could not have been better, great hospitality...The hotel manager (bill wiese) went out of his way to make our stay very pleasant, and we wanted to thank him..... Brad and Deby

Reviews.Title: “Great location with free shuttle around downtown”
Reviews.Author: sugarplum1129
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Seattle, parking is expensive and difficult that is why a free shuttle service is great if you are travelling. I just need tosignup for the free shuttle 15 mins.inadvance and they can pick meup 10 mins.after. soap, shampoo and other utilities should be requested or else they will not refill it for you.i love their toiletries. great lotion! The restaurant in the hotel has great food andnot so expensive too. ilove it! Just right across the safeco field, you have a great view of the field and you could hear all the excitement from the room. free laundry too!

Reviews.Title: “The King Jacuzzi Suite is one of the sexiest Seattle hotel rooms I've found!”
Reviews.Author: Lael_Lael
Reviews.Content: I was blown away by the level of service, quality of facilities and special details at this alleged 3 star hotel. Everything is nice and new, clean and the amenities are ample and varied in a very boutique manner. Favorite things: -the friendly front desk staff (even when I made it down to check out at 3pm) -the rooftop outdoor pool and hot tub -the en suite 2 person jacuzzi tub I got in my room for just $50 extra -the counter, sink, fridge and microwave -really tasty coffee -the security of the hotel (they call to verify guests, etc) Less ideal: -weird hours for all the amenities (not even consistent from one to another) -unless you're in town for an expo or game the location is weird and possibly a bit scary -the staff at times provided inconsistent answers to inquiries and could possibly communicate among themselves better so as to avoid confusion Overall it was a ton of fun and I will definitely stay there again some time!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: northernlight_247
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a concert at Wamu theater. The location is fantastic as Wamu theater is directly behind the hotel, and directly in between Qwest Field and Safeco field. The room was very nice with a mini fridge, microwave and in wall safe, and a coffee pot. The room was clean, the bed was very comfortable and it had a nice flat screen tv. The roof top pool and hot tub was very nice with a good number of lounge chairs around the pool. The view was nice with a view of downtown and the Space Needle as well as left field and second base at Safeco Field. One note the Valet service does come with a charge of $22, just a heads up. All in all we were very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: imsell
Reviews.Content: My high school buddy of 40 years and I stayed at the Silver Cloud Stadium from August 15-17 inclusive to take in the Blue Jays series. I do not hand out five star ratings generously but this hotel was perfect in every way. The location cannot be beaten for sporting events. Jimmie's on First was the place to be after the game. The rooms are spacious and absolutely immaculate. I have not seen a shinier and more spotless bathroom. There is a large flat screen TV in every room to get the highlights. The valet parking, although not cheap, is efficient and very professional. The front dest staff are friendly and more than helpful. We walked to Pike's Market and then to the downtown monorail terminal to go to the Space Needle. We ended up taking the monorail back and walking back to the hotel but if we had chose otherwise they do have a complimentary shuttle that would have picked us up at the Space Needle or anywhere within a three mile radius and brought us back. If you didn't bring your laptop, no problem. The business centre has two computers and it is rarely a problem using them. There are plenty of sports bars in the area. It's location is also very convenient if you need to access the I-90 or I-5 as it is on the south end of downtown so there is less traffic whatever time of day. There is no doubt that my friend and I will be attending Blue Jays games when they play Seattle in the future. There is no other place that we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mazz1956
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights before we took off on a Alaska Cruise. This was a nice hotel and we had a pleasant stay. The rooms were a good size and very clean. The refrig in the room was convenient. The staff was very helpful and we also made use of the shuttle bus to Downtown. Hubby and I had a nice meal in the restaurant downstairs. Couldn't ask for more for the price we payed for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alyssa_B25
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here the night before our cruise departed from Seattle. We had an early flight into Seattle and arrived to the hotel by 11am. We were surprised that we could check in early. Our room was very clean and had a wonderful view of Safeco! We took advantage of the view from the rooftop and took some great pictures of Safeco and the skyline. The hot tub and pool on the rooftop made for a nice relaxing evening. In the morning, we had a nice ride to the cruise terminal and they didn't charge us for it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: dy87
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Seattle and we stayed for one night at the Silver Cloud Hotel Stadium. Previous comments complained about the valet parking at $22+tax - it is not cheap, however, we drove around the blocks and thought that the hotel's parking was the safest esp. when there are events going on at the 2 sports stadiums. Valet service was very good - very polite and wait time was minimal. Check in was a breeze. And we got upgraded to a suite :) That was a really nice surprise. Also we got the lowest price booking the hotel through their website than hotwire/priceline. The room was a 5 stars, with comfy couches, a microwave and a mini fridge. The vending machine on our floor sold pops and water for $1 (awesome deal). We got a great view of the Safeco Field on the 7th floor but the best is going to the rooftop and enjoying the pool/whirlpool while enjoying the scenery of Seattle. The pool is not very deep (3ft9 deepest) - so ideal for children while parents get to suntan and relax on the lounge chairs. There is also a phone that directly allows you to order food from the restaurant/bar (Jimmy's) downstairs. The servers bring the food up to you. The shuttle is one very attractive service offered by the hotel. You just have to reserve a spot at the front desk and they are on time. We went downtown and had dinner at the crab pot. The shuttle took us just in front of the restaurant. We called to have it picked us up, and within 10 min (as they said it would arrive), the shuttle was ready to bring us back to the hotel. Only downside - we were not able to book the hotel for another night because it was all booked up :( This is to say how awesome it is! :) We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is going to the game at either Century Link Stadium or Safeco Stadium and to whoever is not picky for walking 15-20 min to downtown or take the complementary shuttle!

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to walk to downtown!”
Reviews.Author: IGDM
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Priceline - indicated that we wanted a hotel downtown. The Silver Cloud Stadium is strictly speaking downtown, but at the far end. It is a good 20 minute walk which is ok but the area around the stadium is a bit iffy and our kids were nervous when walking during the evening. Having said that, the hotel itself was clean and comfortable and the staff were friendly. Great place to stay but just realize that you will not be in central Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific, looking forward to the next trip.”
Reviews.Author: Timothy C
Reviews.Content: Great room. It was nice to be on the courtyard room because we left our window open and listended to the fountain. Very quite, and soothing. Great proximity to the Qwest and Safeco baseball field. The shuttles were great because they took us to space needle, dining establishments and to Pikes street. We didn't even drive our car during our stay. We were able to safely walk to the Pioneer warf. Fair price, book on line early for extra savings.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located for a Mariner's game.”
Reviews.Author: mccrearyacres
Reviews.Content: Stayed here specifically because we had Mariner's tickets & it had nearly-front-row seats from the field--directly across the street! There were some downsides to the whole stay, though. #1 Price--come on, really? $300/night? #2 Pool was the size of a kiddie pool--especially if you take into account how many guests the hotel holds. But if we were to ever return to Seattle for a game, we'd suck up the cost to have the convenience. Customer service was exemplary & the public transportation is right outside the front door for easy sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great value but a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Formiga
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay. The room was large, clean and comfortable. They have a decent breakfast menu at the hotel's restaurant. My only concerns were about the location (multiple cab drivers told us nicely not to walk around the area in the evening) and the noise youcan hear when your neighbor leaves their room. The doors slamming shut were very loud.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: kimmberley
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place to stay. Steps away from Safeco field. The food at Jimmy's on First Restaurant was excellent. The staff were very courteous and helpful. The shuttle service is a bonus. Would definitely be my first choice of hotel when visiting Seattle again.

Reviews.Title: “Watch for parking prices!”
Reviews.Author: 604Jimmy
Reviews.Content: I had a car with me, and knew that parking would be $22+tax a night. When I checked out, I was surprised to find out that after taxes it came to $26.84. That's a 22% tax! I went to the front desk to find out what the break down of the $4.84 was. But all they could say was the the it was just a 22% "service tax." Really not happy that the tax rate and break down on parking was not transparent. I got the hotel through Hotwire when I had the area, Pike Place Market selected. Its a 20min walk so its no where in that area. They do have a shuttle bus that goes there. The shuttle bus leaves every 30 mins and it was actually pretty handy if you're doing the normal tourist thing. Rooms where nice, the the roof top hot tub was cool. The pool was small and is less than 4 feet deep and was always full of children splashing around. Even though its on the outskirts of downtown, the shuttle buses make up for its distance. I would actually stay there again, but only because they have a convenient shuttle bus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service and property”
Reviews.Author: mck_krg
Reviews.Content: We went down for a Mariners game. The location, as others have mentioned, cannot be beat. The staff both in the hotel and the restaurant/bar is excellent-very helpful and friendly. The menu in Jimmy's is great. The room (one bedroom suite) had a great layout, so if travelling with others, there is no need to walk through a bedroom to get to the bathroom. The beds, both regular and fold out, were comfortable. Will definitely be returning to this hotel for a weekend game!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: easttowest88
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this hotel. Big room, sink and small refrigerator in the room, big bathroom. Very clean, quiet and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it if you're attending a game at Qwest or Safeco”
Reviews.Author: nhd
Reviews.Content: We've twice stayed here with when we've gone to Seattle. Four of us (my husband and I, and our daughter and her husband( share a suite). The sleeping areas are separate from each other, providing privacy. Accessing the bathroom doesn't necessitate going through either area. Hotel is clean. The location is terrific if you're attending a game. It's nice to be able to park the car and go around on foot, Easy access to Pioneer Square, Waterfront, International district. Downside - breakfast isn't included.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay with family”
Reviews.Author: Kalistrat
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for a few days prior to our departure on a cruise to Alaska. I was afraid that the place would be too noisy because of the location - between the two stadiums. But, I was wrong. No games were going on during the time we were in Seattle and the hotel was very calm and relaxing. It is a modern hotel with very clean and relatively large rooms. There is a beautiful pool and a jet tub on the roof, so you can enjoy some views of the port and one of the arenas while lounging. Jimmy's restaurant downstairs was really good too. We wanted to try out some other breakfast places around, but after our first breakfast there we got addicted, and ate there all the consecutive days. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. Everybody acted with professionalism, yet in a very warm manner, that made us feel like we were staying at a resort. I would like to give this hotel the highest rating simply because of the experience we had. We've stayed at some more luxurious hotels, but this one was perfect for its star rating, and we would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near downtown!”
Reviews.Author: RoadTrippin721
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with clean rooms, great amenities (refrigerator and microwave in room), Aveda products and complimentary van transportation to town, extremely efficient room service and nice, attentive staff. Hotel is described as in downtown by Priceline, however, this is not accurate...it is at least half of a mile south of Pike Place Market and blocks and blocks from any major shopping and restaurants. For light sleepers, it may be difficult to rest as there is some train noise, traffic and possible noise from Safeco Field right next door (although we were there on a game night and were not bothered by any noise). Be prepared - valet parking (only option) is $22 per night. Overall, a wonderful hotel...would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: BShafiee
Reviews.Content: I bought through priceline name your price, for about CAD $100. stayed one night. Very large room with good quality bath products (Aveda). A little too far from the centre of the city and it was a little scary to walk downtown at night since we didn't know what kind of a neighbourhood it was. walked for a little and took a taxi $5. parking was not free but they accomodated our car with the Trailer attached. The restaurant has a really good breakfast. If the location was a little closer to the city centre I would definitely return. but very clean and spacious. Front desk staff helpful and friendly. Quick check in and check out.

Reviews.Title: “If you need to use the shuttle, forget about it.”
Reviews.Author: Twinparks
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, convenient location, restaurant on site. Given their distance from the downtown core, their promoted shuttle service was the reason that we stayed here. Unfortunately, the shuttle was virtually unavailable during our entire stay and the desk staff didn't seem to care. We ended up renting a car. If you are going to a baseball game or football game and don't need a shuttle, it's a great location. Otherwise, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel for Mariner Fans !”
Reviews.Author: Lorenzo1317
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several Silver Cloud Hotels in Washington. They are all very nice. The rooms are above average, beds comfortable, big screen stereo TV, and FREE wireless and ethernet ! (we can never figure out why Hilton's and the higher priced hotels still charge for internet ???). The hotel is directly across the street from Safeco Field, We love getting a room on the 9th floor facing the stadium, you can actually sing the National Anthem from your room and still make the first pitch ! The soaps are all Aveda, large mirrors, the bedding clean and comfortable, and the desk was well appointed with electronic gadgets to support your online needs. Microwave, fridge, and coffee maker as well as a room safe, and to top it off, the windows open ! Ahhhh... fresh air, always nice in a hotel. The room had all the necessary amenities and the quality was higher than a HIlton, Embassy Suite, or Sheraton. There is a great rooftop pool and spa and the bar / restaurant ( Jimmy's) downstairs is the place to be before and after the game. Food is typical big city prices but our meals were good. The staff was friendly and arranged our south facing Safeco stadium room request. They offer FREE shuttle to almost anywhere you want to go downtown, and they pick you up as well, 7am to 11 pm. They also stored our Bikes in the Valet's closet. We met the GM in the elevator and he introduced himself and inquired if everything was fine, nice touch. It is within walking distance to the Ferry terminal which is also convenient. It's about a 30 - 45 minute walk to Pike Street market, but an inner city interesting walk through old town. All in all it's the best place to stay if you are attending a Mariner or Seahawks game.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and better service!”
Reviews.Author: Mdevereux
Reviews.Content: Just held our event in Seattle and had a block of rooms at this hotel. The hotel was very nice, kept up well but most importantly had great service and worked hard to make our event successful. I was able to enjoy a very good meal at Jimmy's and definitely recommend it. Looking forward to being back next June and for years to come!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the baseball or football stadium”
Reviews.Author: BrianH40
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times. I typically stay Marriott or Hilton for the points, but this place is right at safeco field, which is just too convenient to pass up if you are going to a game. Rooms are modern with flat screens. Restaurant is good and bar fills up after a game.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Outstanding Manager and Staff”
Reviews.Author: pclmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Silver Cloud Hotel Stadium prior to going on an Alaskan Cruise. We were celebrating our 10th anniversary. This hotel far exceeded our expectations. The room was fantastic, the location was great, and the shuttle that took you to various downtown locations was superb! The security was phenominal, you had to use your room's key card to operate the elevator, something more hotels should do. One of the best parts of this hotel is the manager, Bill Weise, he is by far the best in the business! If we ever go to Seattle again, you can bet we will be staying here and I have already been telling everyone I can about it. Thank you, Bill, for everything!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed all aspects of this hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Ocsue5273
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Silver Cloud Stadium on a Phillies Road Trip with a large group. The hotel was spotless, across from Safeco Field with a free shuttle to the other sights of Seattle. The staff was very friendly and efficient. The only bad thing that happened during our trip, the Phils only won one out of three games!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful- I would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: happytravellers73
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as an overnight on a brief visit to Seattle. I could not fault the staff, the room service, the cleanliness of the room, the free wifi...or the view of the Space Needle from the room! There is a free shuttle bus in the morning to take you wherever you want to go (which is handy given how hilly Seattle is!) I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and we will definitely be back.”
Reviews.Author: AlbaR14
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not downtown but in between safeco and Qwest Fields - great for people watching accompanied by a festive feeling. It was very, very clean and quiet. We were upgraded to a suite which was lovely, well equipped and very comfortable. We walked all around the area, and although we have visited Seattle many times, discovered lots of new places. We walked all the way to downtown and way beyond and it was an easy, colorful and lovely walk. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lycheeice
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Silver Cloud Hotel Stadium for 1 night before our cruise to Alaska. The hotel is very nice. The shuttle service to the downtown area is very convenient. Also, the shuttle to the cruise terminal saved us some headache in trying to figure out how to get to the cruise with all luggage. The room was very nice and very clean. I would recommend all to consider staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: Solrac24
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel for its location, near the Amtrak train station and light rail system. I stayed one night, I was taking the train early next day to Vancouver and I wanted to make it an 7 minute walk to the station, not having to mess with early morning traffic jams at another place. Also, it was a 20 minute ride from the Seattle-Tacoma airport rail station to the Stadium Station, 2 blocks away from the hotel. Five bucks is the total price for two riders, on a clean and moderm light rail system. The ride was fun and entertaining. The hotel, staff and room were excellent. No complaint on any issue. Very professional staff. Clean, well appointed rooms, comfortable beds and pillows, good sized rooms. A heated pool on the roof top, with a whirlpool adjacent. Price was not too excessive, but not cheap either. The only downside was the great location for the hotel for the stadium itself, across the street. If there is a game that day, on either stadium, just be ready for some people watching as the streets are full of a wonderful spectacle, if you like "Go Sounders, Mariners or Seahawks....." just a little busy for some. Good place overall. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, good locale, terrible staff”
Reviews.Author: mpmalone
Reviews.Content: very nice rooms, great locale next to the stadiums, fun environment on game days. appreciated the shuttle bus that carts you around the immediate downtown area. However, the day-time staff in the hotel seemed to know very little to nothing about the city. could make no recommendations & oftentimes did not know about the places they were questioned about. Also, would often call & get plans for the shuttle for pick-up or drop-off, & was consistently told the wrong thing by the front-desk, according to the bus drivers. Was told they had airport pickup, but it's just a town-car they must have a contract with which cost $50. save your money & get a taxi or ride the light-rail. terribly disappointed in the hotel staff, but nice place otherwise...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect for stadium events. Less convenient for downtown.”
Reviews.Author: beardiegal
Reviews.Content: If we'd been in Seattle for a sports event, this would be a glowing recommendation. But as we were in Seattle for city, the out of the way location (healthy 20+minute walk to downtown), was an issue. They do offer free, convenient shuttle drop off to anywhere in downtown, Pike or Space Needle area, which we used regularly, and the drivers shared a wealth of info (better than most tour guides) and were charming . That aside, everything else was great (not luxury, but great). The hotel was clean, airy and well appointed, the staff was extremely helpful and courteous (great recommendations for eats, etc), the complimentary valet parking efficient . Room was spacious. A wonderful aspect of this hotel is the roof pool and spa, looking out over the city. The attached restaurant is a noisy sports bar with man food that made all the guys in the family very happy. Noise was not a problem. Good, light impenetrable window coverings. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Lovethebluesky
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the convenience of staying at this Silver Cloud location. It is great to step out the front door and have the ball park directly across the street. The rooftop pool and jucuzzi are highly recommended as they are warm and cozy on a cool evening. We found the hotel to be clean, quiet, and roomy.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: aspy01
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the silver cloud for a quick weekend break , nice room, clean comfy beds , restaurant in the hotel is good , not to pricey . its a good walk to pike place , but lots to see and do on the way i would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Top of our list”
Reviews.Author: Joonthego
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant to stay at the Silver Cloud at the Stadium due to some negative reviews regarding noise. Much to my surprise this turned out to be a NON issue. We enjoy attending the local MLB team, the Mariner's and thought as this was right across the road it would enhance our experience by eliminating the drive. I am pleased to report that the service is great, check in is superior and not only did it enhance our experience it elevated it for the simple reason that the game fever is on the streets and you can choose to join in or stay away. The stadium is but a mere few feet away and we enjoyed that. My only complaint is the availaibility. We waited too long and had to book elsewhere for one of our game days and it looks like this is an on going issue (good for the hotel to book up). The only down side was the valet service was incredibly backed up.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: MelissaC39
Reviews.Content: We were here on a really busy weekend - U2 was in town, and there were three Mariners games. The hotel has the BEST location for going to a game. We were right across the street from Safeco field, and just down the street from Qwest Stadium. The service was good, and room was clean and spacious. The only downside was the lack of great restaurants in the immediate vicinity, but they have a free shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect. Just what we were looking for.”
Reviews.Author: BrookeinOregon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Silver Cloud for 2 nights in June 2010. We had two 7 years old girls with us to attend a Mariners game and this hotel was the perfect location at a great price. We were able to walk everywhere from the hotel and the girls loved the rooftop pool. We will definitley be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LAsoozq
Reviews.Content: Couldn't ask for more if you want to attend a sporting event or the theater across the street. The restaurant, Jimmy's on First, had a nice menu selection, was reasonable, the food was good, and the service terrific. In an end room (yet facing the courtyard), we had a fabulous view of Safeco Field. Watching the stadium staff get ready for the game and the music playing just added to the sports ambience; we couldn't wait until our game started. Also took full advantage of the shuttle service to either 5 or 6 tourist destinations downtown. The shuttle runs every 1/2 hour from the lobby, and when you're ready to be brought home, just give them a phone call and they will pick you up within 10 minutes...maybe less. The room had adequate storage and hanging space. Was nice to have a separate bedroom with big screen TV from the living area. Love having a frig and microwave, too. The bathroom was particularly nice...a huge walk-in shower and a vanity with "cubbies" to put toiletries out of the way so the cleaning staff could do their thing. Some hotel vanities are so crowded you have no room for your stuff; this one was fabulous. Lots of towels, too, and plenty of room for 2 people to be in there at the same time. I think I miss the bathroom most, lol. The staff was very helpful, and we never had a problem using the business center computer and printer. We were so busy, we were always too tired to use the fitness center, but did check them out. There are two treadmills with TVs attached which was cool, so no fighting for the remote as in some other hotels. Also checked out the roof pool and hot tub, but didn't use them; too cold while we were there, but they were nice. The hotel is not located directly downtown, but the shuttle makes up for that, so if your main plan is to attend one of the nearby stadiums, I HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeper sofas in the suites are worn out....shabby....extremely uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: TigerFan16
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay, with the location right across from Safeco Field, and I have and will continue to stay there. However, for a higher end Hotel and the extra you have to pay for it, the sleeper sofas in the suites are disgusting. You are better off to just get another room instead of subjecting yourself to a horrible nights sleep. I have talked to the management about and nothing has been done.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: grana103
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Silver Cloud overnight before catching Amtrak to Vancouver for an Alaskan cruise. I chose this hotel because of it's proximity to King Street Station and reviews I had read on Trip Advisor. I was not disappointed! The hotel is beautiful. Front desk personnel were cordial and upgraded us to a suite without my asking. There was a ballgame that night and I was a little concerned about noise from the stadium, but for no reason. My Husband was too keyed up to just relax, so he chose to go to the game while I grabbed a sandwich from a stand by the stadium and returned to our suite to check my e-mail and shower. The only noise I heard were muffled cheers when Seattle scored. The suite was huge and had everything you could ever need. There was a bar area, mini-fridge, microwave and coffee maker, an iron and ironing board, robes, lots of pillows and a very comfortable bed. The free wi-fi was fast and easy to figure out the chairs and sofa in the living area were comfortable and I could actually see the playing field. The bathroom had a tub with shower and a large walk-in shower and lots of thick fluffy towels and nice quality soap. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone visiting Seattle. They also offer a shuttle around town.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Salsadancer146
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a very easy walk from the Amtrak station, passing around the stadium. The restaurant on site was nice to have, as there was not much within easy walking distance of the hotel - except for the Pyramid Brewery which was great! The hotel was extremely busy on the weekend and quite loud due to an event at the stadium that weekend. But overall during the week it was quiet and comfortable. The hotel shuttle was beyond helpful. I was able to go into downtown and visit the shops, the Space Needle and Pike Place Market for free. Staff was extremely friendly and arranged my transportation to the airport with no issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, the shuttle service is great!”
Reviews.Author: BrookeChandler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got a great rate for this hotel through priceline. The hotel is located across the street from Safeco field, far from downtown. However the hotel offers a shuttle service to all of the major tourist attractions downtown. My family was there for two days and we did not have to get the car out once. The shuttle picked us up and dropped us off every place we wanted to go. The longest we had to wait for a pickup was 15 mins. The cost for valet service is reasonable at $22 per night. Internet is free in the business center--which is a huge plus. Overall we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place With Everything Going For It”
Reviews.Author: cityroute16
Reviews.Content: Having previously stayed here at the Silver Cloud Stadium, I am impressed each time I walk through the doors. The location is perfect for sporting events or other entertainment near Qwest and Safeco Fields. The rooms are well appointed and CLEAN. The place is never unkempt looking or in need of housekeeping. The restaurant, Jimmy's, is a first class establishment without the 5-star prices. The staff in Jimmy's are always courteous and we have never had a bad meal or service there. From the moment you check in with a vehicle in their covered parking garage, you get the feeling you are in a top notch place. The management and front desk staff get you through the checking process and can get you in your room in no time. I apologize if I sound like a shill for the Stadium SC, but I've stayed other places and got a lot less for a lot more. And treated like a leper doing it. General Manager Bill Weise and Front Office Manager Sara Vandandaigue are representing the Silver Cloud product as excellent people and I thank them for it. If you want a great time, go there. Get an inside room and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: justravel
Reviews.Content: The location is not really downtown. We tried to take a shuttle from the hotel @ 7:00pm after arriving but it was full until 9:30 pm (too late for dinner). We tried again to get back from the theater @ 11:15 pm but it stopped @ 11:00 pm. The room had two lights burnt out and we were trapped in an elevator for 10 minutes and walked down the stairs. (only 2 elevators). Checked on Sunday @ 11:00pm and had to wait 30 minutes for our car. (only 2 attendants). We felt sorry for the long line of people behind us. We will be staying somewhere else in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful staff, awesome pool!”
Reviews.Author: lizbet1053
Reviews.Content: My kids (4 year old and 6 year old), and my sister (16 year old) stayed there for a night while visiting Seattle. The front desk staff was wonderful, she even upgraded my room to the king suite. The kids enjoyed the outdoor roof top heated pool. We really enjoyed our stay. We will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD HOTEL, LOCATION SO-SO”
Reviews.Author: tobeginwith
Reviews.Content: The Silver Cloud is modern and clean with a nice staff. We won this property on Hotwire and it was totally worth the price we paid but, unless you're going to Safeco or Qwest Field, it's a little out of the downtown core, about 25 blocks south of Pike Place Market. Valet parking (a must since there's little to no street parking) is $22/day. The hotel runs a shuttle to downtown, which is handy. The rooms come with a fridge, microwave and coffeemaker, always a big plus for me. A big wall-mounted tv is great but if you have 2 beds in your room one bed likely won't have a good view of the tv and the tv doesn't pivot. The bathroom was clean and spacious but the lighting was harsh and overly bright. No overhead lights exist in the room, which is a drag but typical of most modern hotels. The bed was firm and comfortable but the pillows were cheap and synthetic, none were fluffy. I travel a lot so I'm pickier than most, though! If you pay less than $150 night you will likely be satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Loud train horns all night”
Reviews.Author: weloveRtrips
Reviews.Content: I'm not a light sleeper but was disappointed with the Silver Cloud Stadium's noise level. The hotel is constructed in a "U" shape with rooms facing either streets or an inner courtyard. Do not stay facing the streets. My father-in-law stayed in the inner courtyard room and said he heard "faraway" train horns. He was lucky. One building away from the property were trains switching at odd hours of the night (I assume servicing the container ships just behind them) with-did I mention-LOUD horns which woke even me during the night. The property was nice. $22 to park(!) but a nice shuttle willing to take/pick up all over downtown. Overall pricey, but you are paying for the porximity to Qwest/Safeco Fields so if that's not needed, I think I'd stay elsewhere. My wife's quote was she liked everything about the hotel (room, restaurant, bar, shuttle, bathrooms) but would she stay here again? NO!

Reviews.Title: “You stay here because of convenience..great location for stadium or business”
Reviews.Author: Bcr8tve
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel for value and location if attending event or have business in the area. The restaurant Jimmy's is super, fun clientele, super waitstaff. Complimentary wi-fi as well as courtesy van. I used the van once when the power was off for over 2 hours because of event out of the hotel's control. Unfortunately, I found management lacking during the crisis and they made no effort to make guests comfortable while power was off and restaurant closed. Staff was huddled around the gas fireplace in the lobby and the only guest offer made was to show them where to walk up the stairs to enter room. Since the outage occurred from 11-1:30pm - the most frequent question was "where can i go to get something to eat?" I sat in the lobby for over an hour and it would have been a nice touch for the hotel to have offered hot beverages or a snack in the lobby. At around 5pm when i returned, my room on the 6th floor had no heat. Engineering was called and they responded promptly by resetting a HVAC button in the closet. Traffic noise, sirens were loud and my husband wore ear plugs to sleep. There is some sort of clean air window in the room but the clips were broken off so it was not soundproof. In spite of the issues, the room was comfortable, clean, in good shape - well the shower curtain was ripped but other than that for a hotel with high occupancy it was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, friendly staff but far away from the city core”
Reviews.Author: Gnomixa
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel overall - it's newish, clean and the staff are friendly. Can't comment of the room service or restaurant food as I didn't try either. However, the only reason one would stay there is if they are going to attend a sports event at one of the stadiums. Otherwise, you would have to spend your time and money getting to and from downtown Seattle. The hotel has a shuttle (free) that can drop you off and pick you up (you have to arrange both) from downtown, which is nice, but again requires making arrangements = hassle/waiting. Bottom line, if you want to hang out d/t, don't stay there; it's much more convenient to stay d/t and walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “LOOOOOVED IT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nikclay
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed here the first weekend of Novemeber, 2010. I forgot to write the review until I needed to look up hotels for our next trip! :) We flew in to Seattle to attend a Seahawks VS Giants game, and wanted the proximity to the stadium, since we hadn't been to Seattle before. What we actually got was a WHOLE lot more! Yes, it is literally right next to both the Seahawks stadium AND the Mariners stadium, but its really a short walk to anything, though if you dont feel like walking, they have a FREE SHUTTLE! I spoke to Chris to book my reservation, and he was BEYOND friendly and helpful, and made me feel very comfortable about the hotel and area in which it is located. He suggested restaurants and things to do, and boasted on their shuttle service, which has service pickup/drop-off points, though if they are not busy when you call, they may be able to pick up/drop you somewhere specific. The rooms are great! We originally booked just a normal king room, on the 9th floor, which was perfect, great size, and CLEAN! :) (see pics) Our TV, however, kept turning itself on and off...hmmm... so they moved us to a fantastic SUITE (!) on the same floor. This particular suite had windows that allowed a view of both stadiums, and the street below. On game day, we LOVED this! You could feel the excitement coming up from the street. :) The beds (in both rooms, actually) were comfortable, not too hard, not too soft. Great pillows. iPod docking alarm clock radio. Seattle's Best coffee with a coffee maker, flat screen TV's (in the suite, there were 2) a mini-fridge, and a GREAT SHOWER! Big, adjustable shower head with excellent flow. Hair dryer, great toiletries (no need to bring your own!) and soft towels. (see more pics! :) We did hear our neighbors on one night, but only for a little while and the rest of our stay was really quiet. Rooms are clean, still in new condition. I really loved this hotel!!! There is a pool and spa on the 9th floor. We did use the spa, but not the pool. The spa was big, with great jets, and it was HOT! Perfect for after a flight in! There is a restaurant (Jimmy's On First) on the main floor, but we are impatient folk and didnt want to wait (it was PACKED ever morning), so we walked a few blocks in to Starbucks. (What?! Its SEATTLE! LOL!!!) However, if you walk out the main lobby door and turn right, there is a little walk-up window cafe right there on the street, about half a block up. Muffins, coffee, etc. The first time we left the hotel on foot, we followed the route along the water, suggested by the reception desk clerk. We love to walk new cities; there is no better way to see ALLLL of it. This was not a bad route, if you want to see the more industrial side of Seattle/freeway/backs of beautiful buildings. We suggest, however, walking out the doors, turning toward Seahawks stadium and walking into the city that way. You get lots of storefronts and interesting things to see. Seattle is just gorgeous! We used the shuttle service several times. They prefer you use their appointment system to use the shuttle, but you forget (as we did) they are very flexible with it. When it took us to the Space Needle/Experience Music Project/Science Fiction Museum one morning, we noticed a McDonalds kitty-corner from us and had breakfast there. There is a magazine in the room, with restaurant suggestions, and we took them. LOL! We tried il Forniao, an Italian restaurant downtown at the mall, which the shuttle was kind enough to drop us at. Another night we tried Elliots, on the pier. YUMMMMMMM! Both were fantastic, reasonably priced, and had GREAT service. We recommend both. On last note, I was unaware the Seattle had LOTS of breweries. LOL! Incidentally, there is even one located kitty-corner from the hotels lobby, Pyramid Alehouse, though we never went in. We were told they had great food, as well as brews. Anyway, we booked a brewery tour, through Great Pacific Northwest Brewery Tours. SOOOO FUN!!! I recommend that as well. They take you to 3 breweries, and you get to try several beers at each. Be aware, they are NOT sample size! :) Bottom line, we LOVED Seattle, and LOVED Silver Cloud Hotel-Stadium. Great service, great location, GREAT STAY! I took so many pics, so if you want more pics or info, message me and I will be happy to share!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and super clean”
Reviews.Author: Vomodo
Reviews.Content: I was surprised by how nice the rooms where. The bed is great, it is quiet and the food in the restaurant is quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - ok location”
Reviews.Author: libtravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for 2 nights in early December. We came down to Seattle to shop and we usually Hotwire a hotel. That's how we ended up at the Silver Cloud Stadium. The hotel itself was very nice. Clean rooms, friendly staff, good water pressure in the shower. We had a 2 queen room and it had a bar area with a mini fridge and microwave. If we had been staying longer I'm sure we would have found those handy. As it was December we didn't have a chance to try the outdoor, rooftop pool or hot tub. We did have breakfast downstairs the first day. I had an omelet and it was good, my friend had pancakes and felt they were salty. We normally try to stay right downtown in the shopping district so we can drop off packages and rest up before dinner. The Silver Cloud does have a shuttle to drop you off and pick you up. We did use it to drop us off at the Harry Potter exhibit near the Space Needle. We ended up taking a cab back to the hotel after we had dinner downtown ($10 including tip). There were no games going on while we stayed at the hotel, and I don't know if noise would be an issue during a game or concert. but we found the hotel to be very quiet. Overall it's not my first choice of hotel for staying in Seattle. But if I got it for the right price on Hotwire again I wouldn't be too disappointed. Really the location was the only drawback for me.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3 star, poor location”
Reviews.Author: Acidentalturist
Reviews.Content: Friendly receptionist, valet parking was quick. Cozy room, somewhat small room, European style, but very modern, had a view to the stadium. Some noise from the trains, but sleeping was easy. Pool on the roof is very nice, restaurant was above average. Location is the main problem, unless you are in Seattle to see a game. There is nothing in the area. They a have a small bus that will take you downtown, walking is 30-45 minutes. Thereâ€™s is a train station at 20 minutes walking but the area appears desert, maybe unsafe. Had a good rate via priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Class & service--A1”
Reviews.Author: NewBernNCPepsi
Reviews.Content: So great. Combined a cruise with trip to Seattle. Silver Cloud was near Safeco where we saw 3 games & near cruise terminal. Services was great & they provided transportation from the ship to hotel & to downtown when we needed it. The rooms are fantastic. Many families were there. Right accross the street from ballpark. If you are going to baseball, football or basketball in Seattle stay HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Valet service”
Reviews.Author: kona2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed two days at this hotel and the room was nice but carpeting had spots and needed to be cleaned also the room service tray was on the floor next to our room for at lease 6 hours. The Valet service was very disappointing after driving a classic Mercedes from Portland in perfect condition It was returned with rear bumper paint abrasion and scratched . It took 20 minute to get the car because another car was parked so close to it which caused the damage est. cost to fix this is about $125-150. We do not recommend this Hotel until they address the Valet service ((International Parking Management) as this turns into very expensive weekend and inconvenient car repair.

Reviews.Title: “a place to go back to”
Reviews.Author: bvdr
Reviews.Content: Brand new room with decent size desk, enormous flatscreen HD TV, microwave oven and Ipod Docking station ! I really liked my stay there. The staff is very helpful, there is a free shuttle bus that brings you to nearby locations. One thing that can be improved is breakfast. There is no continental breakfast buffet. You only have the choice of cooked breakfast. The restaurant has a large choice of delicious food. Just next door to the sounders and the mariners stadium Internet is fast and free of charge

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: netmonster
Reviews.Content: We got this as a downtown hotel through price line and I was not thrilled as it is not in the downtown shopping area but at safeco field. I read the reviews here and was more optimistic. The hotel is new and nice, valet parking was only $20, half of most downtown hotels, restaurant was very nice to us. We did not use the shuttle but saw it all the time. The room was nice, beds too soft for me, but I like a hard bed. Our only complaint was some kind of mechanical hum that our room had. It did not bother us in the day but at night it was ever present. We did hear trains but no big deal for us. I do bidding on price line in Seattle every time and it will not be my first choice but I would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So convienent and safe - we'll be staying there again soon!”
Reviews.Author: Willdfire
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay! The rooms were large with microwave and mini fridge. The tub was deep and with Aveeda bath products, you never want to leave. Beds were super comfy and carpet very plush (isn't it funny the things you notice?). Restaurant on site was delicious. Valet parking for only 20$ - which is inexpensive when you compare other downtown hotels.
