The free shuttle takes you almost anywhere you'd like to go - just be sure to call a few hours ahead to get on the list. Across the street from both stadiums so you can't beat the location. Roof-top deck, pool, and hot tub were still open and although small, were one of the best parts of our stay. Great views of the sunset, the city, and the bay! Can't wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Ground Zero for Seattle Sports”
Reviews.Author: TravelingManSpokane
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in September 2010. I had room 442, facing directly across the street to Safeco Field. (Even though it's across the street, you're so close you feel like you're inside the stadium.) I had enjoyed the Silver Cloud Stadium before, and it was great for a return visit because it's directly between Qwest Field (football) and Safeco Field (baseball). There are basically two kinds of rooms at this hotel, ones with a "view" and the rest which face an interior brick wall. The interior rooms are definitely quieter, but you feel kind of crammed in. The exterior facing rooms are more enjoyable, but you definitely hear street noise, people, cars and trains...and ESPECIALLY noise from Safeco Field. Even when there isn't a sporting event going on there, they play baseball radio snippets at LOUD VOLUME from speakers outside which point directly at the hotel. It's a little weird. But the hotel is new and modern and everything worked. Clean and convenient and the restaurant/bar downstairs (Jimmy's on First) has pretty much everything you need. For this visit, I tried taking the new, light rail in from the airport. It was cheap, fast and convenient. $2.50 vs. $40 or so for a cab. But when you get off at the Stadium Station, it was a little confusing trying to figure out exactly how to walk to the hotel. It wasn't marked. Even though it's only about a two block walk, you can't get directly there in a straight line. From the light rail stop, you walk across the street and down the block towards the stadiums. Then cross the street again, and walk up a curved ramp to your left...then past Safeco Field and then down some stairs or take an elevator back to street level. It's another block to the Hotel. If it's raining, bring an umbrella because you'll get soaked. I wish I had asked for more specific walking instructions from the hotel ahead of time. Next time, I'll know the right way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Room and poll with a view”
Reviews.Author: Hoopy-Harry
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a soccer game at Qwest Field and the location was fantastic,walk out of hotel and you are at stadium. Roof top pool offered great views over city. Rooms were large and comfortable. Jimmys on first, had great selection of drinks and food. It was only a ten minute walk into downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: COBB64
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here to be close to the stadium for a Mariner's game. It was a great choice. I asked for an upgrade, because it was also our anniversary. They gave us a complimentary upgrade to a jacuzzi suite. The rooms are awesome, clean, and have some nice views. It is soooo convenient to walk across the street to the game.... Krista checked us in. She was very helpful, nice, and customer oriented. This place is well worth the money, and you can catch the light rail to the airport or downtown. Pioneer square is right out the door, too. If you think it's a little pricey, check downtown, now that's pricey....

Reviews.Title: “A great deal... from Priceline”
Reviews.Author: RossTam
Reviews.Content: Paid 125USD / night for 3 nights at the Silver Cloud Stadium. The location isn't the greatest if you want to do a lot of walking. Probably a 20 minute walk to Pike Place and retail core. Not a lot of things to do in the area (unless you want to check out the stadium or watch a game at the many sports bars in the area). But they have a fantastic shuttle service that runs 7am-11pm. It takes you to Pike Place, Retail Core, Pioneer Square, the dock, and Space Needle/EMP. It is free of charge (well, a bit with a tip) and it runs every half an hour by appointment. The best part is how they pick you up! You give them a call. They pick you up within 5-10 minutes at any location in downtown. It is a fantastic service. The room was really clean but didn't have a great view. Aveda soap products were awesome. And the 42 inch plasma was really nice with some HD channels too. I also enjoyed the free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lucky88Redlands_CA
Reviews.Content: We loved the rooms, excellent bed. Immaculate, nice Aveda tolieteries. The staff was wonderful, courteous and fun - printed up some local "to do" stuff for us without us asking. The lobby could use a bit of sprucing up but it had a nice vibe. The restaurant attached also had a nice vibe and excellent food - Jimmy's on first. The location is right between the two stadiums, we could see some of the field from our window. If you are going to a baseball or football game - stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant place to stay not far from the AMTRAK station”
Reviews.Author: Ozma
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this Silver Cloud tired, dirty, and cranky. I had made the reservation through an online hotel site, and was not at all sure what I had signed up for - just that the location (near the train station) was good for me, since I was leaving early the next morning on the Coast Starlight (west coast train.) What a nice surprise! I was there a bit before check-in, but the friendly desk staff were able to put me in a room immediately. They offered me a choice between a courtyard room (quieter) or an outside room (noisy) and since I'm hard of hearing, I chose the outside room. My room looked directly into one of the entrances to the stadium! Great fun view, and the substantial drapes kept the lights from bothering me at night. The room was gorgeous, beautifully appointed and immaculately clean. Bed was comfy and the free internet was lightning-fast. Both the hotel restaurant and the local food options were very appealing. My only gripe was being there only one night. If you are looking for a place near either the stadium or the AMTRAK station, this place is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “One word - NOISE”
Reviews.Author: LisaSeattle3
Reviews.Content: I bought this hotel thru a website that does not let you know the name of the hotel until you purchase it. I know Seatlle pretty well and thought since it was based in downtown I'd be ok. I was wrong. I consider this hotel to be on the outskirts of downtown. As mentioned in other reviews there is train noise and I requested a room away from that. I thought I was safe. As I pull up to the hotel I know I'm in trouble because I'm such a light sleeper. The hotel is in between Safeco field and Qwest stadium, litererally just feet away. I thought I was safe since during my stay football season hadn't started and the Mariners were out of town. Didn't count on the soccor game being played at Qwest. Can you say Gary Glitter? Imagine trying to sleep thru the stadium noise , the music, etc. I've stayed in Seattle 3 summers now and this was hotel was my least favorite. Not in a great part of town either. As a solo female traveler this was a problem. The hotel room itself was nice, granite counter top sat on a large bar area, bathroom was very nice and the bed and pillows were comfortable. You'll need those extra pillows as really big ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “great for baseball fans”
Reviews.Author: matissegirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great business hotel. We stayed a few nights with two adjoining rooms for my kids. The train wasn't an issue as others have posted. Breakfast is very expensive. Got a great rate through priceline. Free shuttle van drops you off wherever you need to go in the city. Not the best neighborhood. Very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “beware the fog horn”
Reviews.Author: billycomics
Reviews.Content: all was well except for the fog horn across the street that went off about 15 times during the night! all night. we could not sleep at all. beware! other than that, the hotel is nice. location is a bit from the centre of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel & service”
Reviews.Author: luvlylara
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and luxurious. CHeck in was smooth and our room was great (terrible view though, brick wall!) The shuttle service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel- Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: schweder4
Reviews.Content: Was in Seattle for holiday with family and ball games. Check-in was quick and easy. Valet was great - $20.00/night I thought was reasonable. Rooms were well done, amenities nice and in-room safe was a bonus. Pool and Jacuzzi on 9th floor was a nice touch and seeing the ball park from the pool area was exciting for the kids. Shuttle service was excellent and very efficient. Jimmy's restaurant service and food were great. Costs I thought were fair. Enjoyed our three night stay. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going down for any sporting event.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Stay, with a location you can love / hate”
Reviews.Author: AnacoTraveler
Reviews.Content: Silver Cloud is a small chain of superior hotels in the US Pacific Northwest. The Stadium property is aptly named, since it is the only hotel located between Safeco and Quest Fields in Seattle and is perhaps a 4 1/2 rating, if that were available. How it came to be located there would be an interesting story- but it does enjoy the perfect definition of "Location, Location, Location". The location of the two stadiums, and the hotel, brings the love/hate relationship to bear. They are all located in the rail yards and industrial area south of the Seattle downtown core; and there is industrial and train traffic in the vicinity. So if that bothers you don't stay there- there are thousands of rooms 10 minutes north in downtown. But if you want to be within a few steps of the two fields, this is THE ( actually the only) place to stay. On the plus side: The property is fairly new and has been well maintained. The staff, from valet to front desk to housekeeping to the restaurant and bar was top notch- great attitudes and very good skills. The property is a full service business location in addition to supporting the sports venues. The rooms are large and fully equipped: large plasma TV with every sports station imaginable, refer, micro, complementary internet, wet bar with good coffee, morning newspaper, large bath with lots of counter space and good toiletries. The bed was better than average with good linens. While the rooms are not soundproof, they are good enough considering the cacophony present outside. We ate and beveraged at Jimmy's, the hotel restaurant and bar- service was excellent, food and beverage above average. This is a very good house so the improvement list is relatively short. The hotel has only two public elevators for a nine story building; there are regular lines to use them. And when an event lets out the lines get very long. But this would be a tough fix on a completed building. And the bath towels should be better for a property of this caliber and price. We rated the value down a notch, but they may be debatable. At a minimum of $250 per night and $20 per day for parking that adds a lot to the price of a Mariner, Seahawk or Sounder game. The restaurant prices were stiff but again not out of line for downtown. Keep in mind that Seattle adds plenty of sales/ excise taxes to each of these - 10% for food, 15% for hotels and 19% for parking- so the tariff for a couple of day stay is not insignificant. But it is a quality property and perhaps one just has to suck it up and pay for the location, location, location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Yankeefan17
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by a friend, because I was attending a baseball game at Safeco Field. I can't thank them enough. The location is beyond ideal. The ballpark is literally across the street. The room was clean, tasteful and quiet and the staff were extremely helpful. As a matter of fact, we were given an exceptional recommendation for an oyster bar nearby called "Emmet Watson's" by the Front Desk Clerk which turned out to be a terrific little find. The hotel provides a complimentary shuttle to the market area which I highly recommend as a start point in your travels. The drivers are friendly and extremely accomodating. And when you're ready to return to the hotel, you just call them up (they provide a business card) and they will pick you up within 20 minutes or so to bring you back. After the game, or after shopping in town, I would strongly suggest grabbing a bite or a beverage in the hotel restaurant "Jimmy's". The food is terrific and the atmosphere is very quiet and elegant without being imposing or pretentious. And the oatmeal with cinnamon in the morning is truly to die for. Please give this hotel a try if you are in the Seattle area for business or pleasure. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “If you like the sound of trains all night...”
Reviews.Author: parkstplcondo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and clean, with friendly staff. But I wouldn't stay here again, with or without my family. It was great that our room was spacious so that our little one could play and walk around. But, the hotel is located near some sort of train line and industrial area. All night, we listened to the sound of trains tooting away, which made it hard to sleep for all of us. Parking is $20/night with the hotel as we didn't think it was safe enough to park on the street beside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect 40th birthday”
Reviews.Author: mckinley88
Reviews.Content: stayed at the silver cloud during a quick trip to seattle for my 40th birthday. wife and i both enjoyed the clean and comfortable room and very nice rooftop pool and hot tub - a treat to get to use it during a dry spell in normally 'mizzly' seattle. valet parking is a bit steep at $20/night, but not out of the norm for hotels in/near downtown seattle and SODO. my wife and i are heavy sleepers so not bothered at all by street/train noise, but location next to viaduct, train tracks, and stadiums could definitely be an issue for those bothered by outside noise. perfect location for mariners, seahawks, and sounders games and qwest and safeco fields.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Silver Cloud!!”
Reviews.Author: courtneyandolive
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough positive things about our recent stay a the Silver Cloud Hotel Stadium!! Although I got a great deal on Hotwire, I was initially disappointed because the hotel is located a bit further away from Pike Place/Downtown than most of the other hotels. However, once we arrived I was pleasantly surprised because the Hotel is really nice (more of a 4 star quality) and they have a shuttle service that runs every half hour to Pike Place, Fifth Ave (shopping district), the Space Needle, and Waterfront....which saved us a ton on taxis and was really convenient. Our flight was early so we arrived at the hotel around noon and luckily we were given a room for early check in. The rooms are huge with a very comfortable bed and nice big shower/bathroom; we even had a great view of Safeco Stadium! During our stay we took advantage of the roof top heated pool and hot tub. We never ate at the hotel restaurant, Jimmy's, but heard great things about the food. We did hear a train that went by numerous times during the day, but the sound didn't bother us because it fit with the city setting. This would absolutely be the best place to stay for attending sporting events close by (baseball, soccer).

Reviews.Title: “Good but could be perferct”
Reviews.Author: faithzp
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a nice solid hotel. My initial impression didn't go so well. There seems to be an issue the didn't seem engage at the front desk. The waiting was strange and not because it was overly busy. After this hiccup, we arrive in a room that was quite comfortable. My niece who usually like her own bed was pleased with our large queen. We ordered room service good, tasty and quick. I loved the extra sink area in the room. We only stayed one day as we were leaving for a cruise the next day. The hotel is very convenient for getting to the pier but a bit of a walk to the center of the city. We like to walk so this was okay. May not want to do at night as you have to go near a deserted bridge area.The next day had to find breakfast not a lot of choices. The experience that put this over the just okay range was once again not the front desk interaction., it was a little better. The event concerned the fact that we needed to get to the pier for the cruise. oddly no one else seemed to be leaving for the pier. They had us wait about 40 minutes then finally one of the unengaged front desk people had one of their drivers take us in their van alone. We were not even charged for this and the driver( whose name I am so sorry I can't remember) very nice and welcoming giving a delightful ride to our cruise. Maybe work on the customer service engagement and this would be a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: betrob4
Reviews.Content: A co-worker and I visited Seattle and stayed at Silver Cloud Stadium. We cannot say enough about how wonderful our stay was! They have a free shuttle to almost any destination, which saved us lots of $$. The restaurants they recommended were awesome...Doc's on Baimbridge Island and Serious Pie. The room was huge and very clean. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “We thoroughly enjoyed every minute of our stay.”
Reviews.Author: AnniroC
Reviews.Content: On our recent trip to Seattle, WA (first time to visit), my husband and I stayed at the Silver Cloud Inn / Stadium. It was a business trip with a couple extra days for checking out the city. The hotel is conveniently located on the "Link" (light rail) route direct from SeaTac Airport, so, no rental car needed! The amenities were superb and staff genuinely dedicated to making our stay very comfortable. The shuttle service from the hotel to various points within the city made getting around convenient. (Ian rocks!) I usually don't care for staying in hotels - however, would highly recommend the Silver Cloud Inn. Very clean, great shower, comfortable bed and convenient refrigerator and microwave. The restaurant downstairs (Jimmys on 1st) is a little pricey, especially for breakfast. We heard the local train, but it soon blended in and didn't make a difference. I worked out in the fitness center and it was just right - had all the right equipment. All in all - we were very satisfied and would stay at the Silver Cloud Inn on our next trip to Seattle. Oh, and it was sunny the whole visit! Things to do: Let's go Sailing - 70ft. sailboat leaves from near Argosy Charters. This was a once in a lifetime sail - very memorable (Sunset Sail, 2 1/2 hours). $44pp.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Fleanlee
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Silver Cloud Hotel Stadium and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Staff were extremely obliging even offering to drive us to the station with our luggage for an early morning departure to save us the cost of a taxi fare. Courtesy bus runs approximately every 20 minutes and will take you to most of the major tourist areas, eg: Pikes Place, Space needle, etc. Will pick you up again to take you back to the hotel at the end of your day upon a phone call request. Location is not in the heart of town but this is not a problem because of the service offered. Would be a terrific location for sports fans as it's right next to Safeco Field & Quest Stadium. The bar/restaurant downstairs is a great place to spend a few hours and the meals were decent. Rooms were very nicely presented and the beds were extremely comfortable. Whilst I had concerns about the noise from the nearby train station it was not a problem. You could hear the train occassionaly but not enough to disturb our sleep. The pool and hottub on the roof are an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Crappy Valet Service”
Reviews.Author: BWChile
Reviews.Content: For my wife's 50th Birthday we went to see the Mariners play. This hotel seemed like a natural because it is literally just across the street from Safeco Field. You walk out the front door and and you are at the cross-walk. When we arrived (be sure to check out dates and times of events around the area as traffic may get very congested) the valet took our car, but no one helped us out with getting luggage out of the car or offered to bring it to the room. Check-in was a breeze as I has per-registered on-line. We had a room with jacuzzi on the 8th floor, that looked out to the sound. The room had just one robe and it would have been nice to have two robes especially since it was a jacuzzi room. We stayed for a couple of nights and saw Felix pitch a complete game for a Mariners victory. Once done with the game we just walked across the street and we were back to the hotel! When you are at the games at Safeco it is fun to hear the loud train whistles. But, if you are trying to get rest it can be a problem. The beds were not my favorite and I would describe the mattresses as squishy firm. The room did have a mini refrigerator and microwave. We checked out using the remote control for the TV and called the Valet to bring our car around. I placed $5 in my pocket to give to the valet. Soon after we got to the parking area for pick-up we saw our car come from the garage area. As we started to walk to the area with our baggage , an attendant came running to us and asked for the claim check. I was carry the baggage and said I could give it to him when I got to the car just 10 or so steps away. I got there and set my bags down and as I went to get the claim check he said "don't worry, I don't have time for this" and went away, my claim check and tip still in my pocket. My experience is that in this situation someone would help load the car with the luggage and perhaps exchange a few pleasantries.

Reviews.Title: “Supercross”
Reviews.Author: Kimren
Reviews.Content: Drove to Seattle with another couple for Supercross racing. The hotel is situated on a corner with Safeco Field across the street to the right and Qwest on the corner across the street. An Ideal location. We walked to Qwest for the days events. After the races we walked barely two blocks to Tiki Bob's for several hours of revelry before ambling back to the hotel room. NO driving whatsoever. Our suite was clean. Aveda products for the bathroom. Room had little fridge and microwave. Was comfortable but the best part was the location.!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: hooverthemoovers
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel on Priceline. Traveling with a group of 3. Accidenlty got 2 rooms but glad we did. Price was right ($63). We though this was downtown but it is closer to the football and baseball stadium about a 5 min drive. They do offer free shuttle to wherever you want to go which was very nice. Otherwise very well kept hotel. Would stay again. Downside -location depending on what you're doing. Yes, you can hear the train, but I've learned to tune out noises (thanks to my hubby's snoring).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay - Would stay again for sure”
Reviews.Author: tripfan2885
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The staff is excellent. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Pool and hot tub on the roof. The food in the restaurant is great (Crab Mac n Cheese!!). I would definitely recommend this hotel. Drawbacks: train noise, location is not ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Downtown, but not quite walkable”
Reviews.Author: sweetcheet
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel for stadium access and being in the southside of Downtown Seattle. I actually booked through an agency that sold this as being City Center. I was intially furious, since this location is NOT city center or walkable to city center. However, on it's own merits, the hotel was friendly, has valet parking, a nice bar/restaurant and it was actually quiet. Yes, the train is nearby, but it isn't terribly noticeable. I actually booked another trip at this hotel, knowing that the service was good and I could be treated well. It's a shame that their marketing partners can't play up it's attributes instead of misleading people into thinking that this is a downtown hotel. It's not, but it's a nice place to stay, just the same.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Great except the train noise kept me up all night long.”
Reviews.Author: CanuckleHead12
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great in itself in term of cleanliness, staff, location, rooms are up to date and all other facilities. But the train noise from across the street is way over the top. Trains blow their horns all night long and I was unable to sleep at all. I did read a bit about the noise before but figured how bad it could be but once I turned the TV off and went to bed the loud noises kept me up all night. It is certainly not for light sleepers. I am sure better insulation would reduce this problem. Otherwise the hotel is well kept and has a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great All Around Hotel in the Heart of Stadium Row”
Reviews.Author: icy_blue_vin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife on our way down to Oregon late September. Got an excellent price on our room as there were no sporting events on that evening. If you're looking for a great hotel for less than $100/night, try this spot on a non-game night. Key Features: -Hotel is quite new and very clean. Has a modern feel to it and located within a 4 minute drive to Pike Place market and downtown entertainment centre. If going for a ball game, you can't possibly get any closer than this hotel! - Excellent rooftop swimming pool and hot tub. Direct phone line to the Bar & Grill downstairs if you want to order up food and bevvies. Don't see that often at this price point. - Rooms were very nice. Requested something on a higher floor and was accommodated without a problem. Good size room with modern furnishings. Huge King Size bed with nice linens and extremely comfortable. Large flat-screen TV on the wall. Nice, clean bathroom with decent toilettries. Contrary to what many have indicated here, we did not hear anything or have any troubles with train noise. We did request something on the North side of the building as a precaution, and this was easily granted. We had a courtyard (inside) room and did not hear the fountain at all. Do not be freightened off by some of the other reviews, noise here is not a concern. Really no downsides to this place. Do have to pay for valet parkiing, but as you're downtown there really aren't many alternatives anyways. Overall I couldn't be happer with this place and would gladly stay here again. Please note: We were able to get a room for $85 by bidding on that "William Shatner " website. Room may cost more through a "standard" booking procedure.

Reviews.Title: “If you like sleep, this is not the hotel for you”
Reviews.Author: scdriscoll
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Silver Cloud Stadium while in town to attend a Seahawks game. The location with regards to the stadium (Qwest or Safeco) is PERFECT. The rooms are nice, the free shuttle is fantastic and the bar/restaurant also good. However..... sleep is at a minimum due to the very loud and very close trains. They run all night long and for some reason, blow their whistles constantly. It's unfortunate because this hotel should be GREAT but for the trains alone, I have to rate it average at best. The only other negative was with housekeeping. For some reason they left dirty room service glasses (filled with water and juice) in our room for days. Odd.

Reviews.Title: “Seattle Layover”
Reviews.Author: JaneLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night at this hotel on our way to a family vacation in the San Juan Islands. It was a modern, attractive, smoke-free place, and our room was comfortable, with 2 queen beds, refrigerator, microwave, Aveda toiletries, and complimentary Internet access. Because our stay was short, we didn't have time to take advantage of all the hotel amenities, but certainly having a refrigerator and microwave was very convenient since we were traveling with our 11-year--old son. We were able to get a good deal from Priceline.com. The hotel has a great location, across the street from Safeco Field, if you are a Mariners fan visiting during the baseball season, but it is out of the way for most other Seattle visitors unless you have a car. We had a car, so it wasn't too inconvenient, but one drawback was the high cost of parking, $20/day.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Aussie8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights while travelling to Vancouver. We had booked the hotel on the internet and selected it because we were going to 3 baseball games. Having read some previous reviews about the noise we were apprehensive, but our stay was wonderful. We had a room on the 6th floor which faced into the courtyard and the noise from the trains, while there was not loud enough to disturb our sleep. On checkin the staff were very friendly and the process was smooth and quick. When we checked out early to catch the Amtrak to Vancouver they bent over backwards to assist us with a taxi and our luggage. The shuttle service was great. We caught it to the Space Needle and then worked our way back down through the city by walking. I would highly recommend this hotel. It was expensive but worth it for the location to Safeco Field. (We probably could have picked up a better deal if we had booked later but booking from Australia meant we wanted to make sure we had a hotel in a good location for the baseball.) We love walking so were happy to walk everywhere. We ate breakfast in the restaurant and found it to be good value. Would definitely stay there again the next time we come to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: MINN7
Reviews.Content: Drove with extended family from Portland to see Twins vs. Mariners at Safeco Field. Stayed one night and loved it! The only place to stay if you're in town for a baseball game. Our rooms were ordinary size, but nicely furnished; frig., micro, granite counters and attractive furniture and decor. Dropped our car off after driving from OR, went across the street to a sports bar/restaurant for lunch, and walked across the street to the game. Not a single hassle! Took the complimentary shuttle everywhere we wanted to go and were picked up promptly when we called for return. Did not notice as much of a noise problem as other reviewers. Expensive rooms but worth it for the convenience and service, especially for a night or two. We couldn't have been more pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Best baseball hotel in North America!”
Reviews.Author: DanTTU
Reviews.Content: I make an annual trip to Seattle for one series of my Rangers and M's every year. After three years of staying here I decided to toss my 10 cents worth. The location cannot be beat! You are right there at the stadium and this year my room on the top floor looked almost over into it. It is so close in fact that in April of 08 it was cold and snowy on opening day up there. Yes, that fat wet snow almost like rain it is was not a warm day at all, They tried to open the roof but it was rough. I need another layer and left my seat and went to my room across the street and was back in 3 outs. I missed a half inning something most people do going to the restroom anyway so you can see why the location is perfect. The rooms are standard but not chain like. They are not the Kimpton style I love but they are not the cookie cutter feel either. With Ipod docks and flat screen HDTVs they are on the cutting edge and the suite with the hot tub cannot be beat after a long day walking the city streets and getting ready for the night game. I like the rooms alot and have no issues at all with them. I can stock the fridge with a few beverages of choice and that is always a plus! The front desk every time is just great and getting them to hold my bags for the red eye home with my pre-arranged car waiting makes it a snap to catch the game and fly out after. In 08 I had to do that and they helped me line up my return to the airport following the game. This year I had plenty of time to unwind before my cab to the airport after the day game. Jimmy's the hotel bar/restaurant is great and one of the bar tenders remembered me from the year before. This year I did less on the town tourist wise but the shuttle will get you around downtown with no problem and the after hours the cabs are just 6 bucks or so back if you are out later than when the shuttle runs. I cannot say enough what a perfect location it is and what a great place to stay it is. I almost always stay with one of my partner hotels to get miles or in many places I look at Kimpton first then everyone else but Seattle is different. Maybe my love of baseball makes me love this place even more but whatever the case you cannot beat walking right out the front door and to your ball game seats in 5 minutes! Awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in seattle”
Reviews.Author: idajimmi
Reviews.Content: Truly, if you stay at this hotel you will not get any sleep .The freight trains run past here almost every 20 minutes with their horns blaring. At 10:30 pm we asked to be moved to a quieter side of the hotel and even there we could hear the trains. The hotel itself is nice and new, rooms are good but bring ear plugs. The location is not convenient if you want to go downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Still pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Vancouver_WA
Reviews.Content: Our first stay was a year ago, and we were impressed by just about everything about this hotel. This time, though, a few problems. The wired internet service no longer works, but the wireless does, although it's rather slow. The shuttle is often overbooked even if you call two hours in advance, this happened twice in less than two days. And try not to get a room on the 1st Avenue side of the hotel, very noisy train horns and fire sirens all night long, even on the 8th floor. We will probably stay here again next year, but as with all new hotels, it's sad to see it go downhill from one year to the next. Oh well.

Reviews.Title: “Not an OK experience”
Reviews.Author: alexmoral
Reviews.Content: Arrived to the Silver Cloud Hotel on August 5th 2009, after 3:00 PM, after a long, long flight, on Game night. The hotel is just accross the street from the Safeco Field, all streets were closed by Seattle Police, detouring traffic, streets packed with cars and people. Managed to make it to the hotel despite all the traffic inconveniences, hundreds of pedestrians...first night, no problems, rested well, would have rested better, but there is a railroad facility close to the hotel and the trains blow their whistles at all times, day or night, so unless you are used to the noise (2-3 nights) you will be awake most of the time. Third day, friday, departed at 05:00H to catch the Ferry for Victoria BC . We made sure our room dooor was shut locked. Arrived from Victoria, BC on saturday afternoon and to our surprise our room door had a "Privacy please" sign, that we did not leave there. I thought my room had beed given away to another guest. After trying to open our room door a few times and seeing that the key was not working, we decided to give it a little push, discovering that it had been opened by someone else and left open. The room had not been touched by housekeeking at all, for 2 days. It was just as we had left it. Nothing we could do at that time since we had made reservations for dinner and were kind of in a rush. We called the main desk, asked for soap and fresh towels, which were delivered soon. After dinner we returned to the hotel, it was around 10:15PM, tried to open the room, keys did not work this time. Went to the front desk, reprogammed them, tried again, nothing. After going back and forth to the front desk to reprogam the keys, three times, our door still remained unopened. 5 staff personnel, (as if I did not know how to do it), came and tried to open the room, for a total of eight tries now, finally realizing that the lock was somehow damaged. It is now past 11:00PM, we are still locked out of the room and the maintenance person is gone for the night. Front desk stated that the hotel was at its full capacity and they could not provide us with a courtesy room to spend the night, therefore; we had to wait for the maintenace guy to come back from his home, at that time of the night , and see what was wrong with the door lock. We went back to the front lobby to wait there, were given two small bottles of Minute Maid orange juice for consolation, and were told that maintenance had been contacted and that within 15 minutes the problem was going to be solved. At 12:30 AM, after 2 hours and 45 minutes locked out of our room, tired and sleepy, front desk finally told us that our door had been opened by maintenance and that the problem was that the lock since it is electric, had run out of batteries. WHAT!!!!???? Don't they perform preventive maintenance or their equipment???? Don't they change the door lock batteries periodically?? For the price they charge for their rooms, the lock ran out of batteries, that's it??????. How do they explain that someone opened that door, left it open, placed a "privacy please" sign on the door, but no one reported that the lock was having problems? Needless to say my night was trashed, ruined, wasted. Next morning we were able to speak to Mr. Mark Lee, director of guest services, he was very kind and understanding of our situation. This hotel is not a bad one, it is just that you travel and try to book a good hotel, even if you have to pay a few more dollars, so you don't have to worry about things like these, but unfortunatelly, it happens.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: HamonGrande
Reviews.Content: With any hotel, the ability to SLEEP is critical. Apparently, there is a train freight yard near by, for which the engineers are blowing their horns to at least 1AM and starting again at 5AM. I am not talking short horn blasts either; more like blasts to alert any homeless folks sleeping on the tracks 2 miles down the rails. I can only assume they actually stopped with the horns between 1AM and 5AM, or I passed out due to exhaustion. In summary, 4hrs of sleep TOTAL over two nights. I was "upgraded" to this room too. My company used PriceLine, so maybe my upgrade was punishment... Regardless of any other hotels features, I cannot recommend this hotel to any business travellers. In case you decide to give it a go, this was a west facing room. Keep this in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Content: Very hard to find this motel, even with directions from the staff. No self parking, only valet ($20 per night plus tips). This is not clear on their website. Very clean everywhere. Friendly staff. Cool rooftop pool overlooking Safeco Field. Average size room but lots of amenities. Extremely comfortable beds!! Kind of a hassle to check out--you must physically present yourself at the front desk to sign your bill (didn't they get my signature at check-in?!). Convenient to go to a Mariners game--walk across the street!

Reviews.Title: “very pleased”
Reviews.Author: lesley85
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were celebrating a girl's 21st birthday, so we made a girls trip to seattle, and stayed here for 1 night. They upgraded for free to a suite with a pull out bed/couch and seperate room with a great view of the stadium!!! I loved the ipod deck in the room, and the large tvs. We got a few complaints for being too loud, but the hotel staff were so nice, and told us they understood we wanted to party but told us to keep it down. The valet parking was nice, and the guy at the desk (concierge maybe?) gave us some coupons for clubs as well as a restuarant and some good tips on where to go. We also got a free shuttle to the restuarant. We had a drink at the restuarant and they were expensive but it was nice!!!! We got back to the hotel around 3am and we were so drunk that we hung out in the lobby for about an hour talking to the guy at the front desk, and he even helped us order food. We also had room service in the morning and it was pricey but nice!!! I would recommend this place to anyone, it was great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelieveable, honest staff”
Reviews.Author: beach4nut
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an Alaskan cruise. We stayed the day before our departure at Silver Cloud and 2 days after the cruise. All the reasons we selected this hotel, using Trip Advisor as our biggest research and personally speaking to Mark (hotel manager), were right on spot. The 2 room suite was perfect for my husband, myself and 2 grandchilden (11 & 14). The shuttle was a lifesaver. We would call the desk for a specific time and it always worked out for our schedule. They took us to the ship and picked us up after the cruise. We went to the aquarium and the waterfront, Space Needle, and Pike's Place Market. The drivers were friendly and very informative. We attended a Mariner's game (we're Dodger fans) and it was fun for all of us. The best part, was it was a across the street from the hotel. The only drawback and it's pretty minor, was there wasn't much around within walking distance. BUT the most important part is the staff. My husband dropped his wallet in the shuttle and someone was at the desk with it as we were just entering the hotel. Amazing...but there's more. We returned home yesterday and couldn't find a book we had purchased and weren't sure where we left it. I called the hotel and the head of housekeeping (Alan) called this morning and found the book that we left in the business center. He is mailing the book to us. The integrity of the staff far exceeds the call of duty. The hotel manager deserves credit for having such a great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at a classy spot”
Reviews.Author: KYtransplant1975
Reviews.Content: From the rooftop pool to the great restraunt and lobby, this hotel is classy. I booked a jacuzzi room with a view of the sound and it was spectacular. The service was nice and loved being so close to the baseball field.

Reviews.Title: “A New Anniversary Tradition!”
Reviews.Author: asneeze
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been getting tickets for a Mariners baseball game for several years now. Each time after the game we would trudge to the car, sit in traffic to get out of the parking lot, and then drive the hour and a half home. Well, no more!!!! On a whim, we made reservations at the Silver Cloud Inn Stadium to stay after our evening game, and we are so happy we did! From the minute we pulled into the hotel, we were treated with great service and people who really seemed to want to do their best to help us. We relaxed before the game, grabbed an appetizer across the street at the Pale Ale Brewery, then leisurely made our way back across the street to the game. After the game, no car and no headache - just a few steps back to our beautiful room. (We requested a stadium view room, which was a fun extra to our trip - we could watch the gate from our window and even see players warming up on the field. Next year we are going to upgrade to a room with a Jacuzzi tub.) We ordered room service desserts (less than 10 minute wait and very tasty!) that night and ate breakfast at the restaurant downstairs in the morning. Our breakfasts were so beautifully presented and so delicious that I took a picture of both plates. We give this hotel a rave review and will be staying there again next year on our anniversary, if not sooner! Thanks, Silver Cloud! *note - We did look in to taking the shuttle to the waterfront. The drivers were very attentive and willing to take us and pick us up wherever and whenever we wanted, but we decided not go so that we could enjoy our time at the hotel and the surrounding area. Seems like a fantastic service!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Kes2106
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a few girlfriends - we all live in Seattle, but need a little girls getaway. Spent the entire stay rooftop poolside with margaritas!! AMAZING view!!! Service was awesome, lots of smiles and everyone was very attentive. We made several room service orders, food always arrived quickly and sizzling hot - even delivered to us at the pool. Our 9th floor room was HUGE and super clean - bathrobes were much appreciated. Valet was fast and made sure us ladies never opened a single door. Close to all of Seattle's hot spots - complimentry shuttle took us to Il Bistro. If your looking for your next staycation and want to feel like a celebrity this is your place. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: marieatta_pman
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at more budget accomodations, but those options are limited in downtown seattle, so stayed here for $75 after bidding on priceline. Pros - very new very clean hotel staff was very friendly shuttle to downtown locations - Pike place, cruise ships, train station, etc... proximity to stadiums for games (baseball+football) Cons lack of restaraunts/shops close to hotel pricey hotel restaraunt area right around hotel was somewhat industrial (train whistles at night)

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL - especially if going to a ball game”
Reviews.Author: LillyChristina
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a vibrant, exciting lobby, lot's going on because of Safeco Field right across the street. The rooms are always excellent, super clean and comfy. Rooftop pool is awesome. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The epitome of what an hotel should be!”
Reviews.Author: morningbarney
Reviews.Content: The best hotel experience we have ever had was during our recent 11 day stay at the Silver Cloud - Stadium in Seattle. Friendly, efficient staff from the front desk representatives, to housekeepers, to those providing prompt service at Jimmy's, the hotel's well run restaurant. Every aspect of the stay offered prompt service with a genuine smile. Combined with the comfortable physical accommodations that included a king-size bed, big-screen TV, internet access, refrigerator, microwave, complementary laundry, pool and exercise room, we really felt like pampered guests at the Silver Cloud. For those of you who will be traveling to Seattle, we recommend the extraordinary value offered by the Silver Cloud-Stadium. It is a most enjoyable place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tienne
Reviews.Content: Positive: Allow you to check in early, the room is clean n comfy, it has microwave and small refrigerator, 42 inches plasma and Ipod charger/clock, a nice rooftop pool, a complementary washer and dryer, free internet connection, free local phone. Negative: Not centrally located, you need shuttle to go downtown - you need to spend at least $20 per day for the shuttle's drivers tips ($5 each way) - otherwise you don't feel comfortable - trust me, The hotel is closed by the port and train station, I woke up couple times during my sleep because of the horn that were coming from the train or the boat. It's so loud and happened a couple times at 2 AM and continued to happen till 6 AM. So if you are coming for the game and did not mind waking up couple times, then stay here. Other than that, this is a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING! What a great find! When can we go back?”
Reviews.Author: eurojamie04
Reviews.Content: We were blown away by this place. Plus, we booked it on Hotwire for less than $90 a night. The service and check in was so friendly and accommodating. We felt like we were in the Ritz! The room was amazing. The bed and linens were comfortable and beautiful. And the bathrooms had Aveda products! My favorite. The little coffee shop next door, Occio, was delicious, and it was just a 10 minute walk to Pioneer Square/Train Station. And a 20 minute walk to Pikes Place Market. The rooftop pool and jacuzzi were sunny, beautiful and fantastic. The restaurant was even good with great mojitos! I would recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great, great, and did I say GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: starchild101
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome! Usually I list the good, the neutral, and the bad. But for this review I will only list the good, and the neutral because there was NOTHING bad I can comment on. Good: Got into town early, they let us check in at noon. Front desk very pleasant. Room, great king size bed, huge tv, microwave, fridge, bar style sink, nice bathroom. Had a nice view of the ballpark, when we stayed the team was not in town. Pool with hot tub on top floor, very nice, pool wasn't huge, but we were there mainly to soak in the hot tub. Had very nice views of the entire city from the pool area - bring your camera. Free shuttle to all the tourist spots AND cruise port!! Drivers were great, we ended up walking most of the time since the weather was spectacular. It's about a 20 minute walk to Pikes Market from here. Neutral: Things that may bother you but really didn't bother us: little bit further down the road, with nothing too close by if you want to pick up some chips, beer, sodas ect. That was about it. Tips: Coffee: excellent hole in the wall place, don't remember the name, walk out the hotel, go towards the downtown area, about a half block down the road there is litterally a hole in the wall that serves great coffee. Also walk again towards the downtown area about 3 -4 blocks down you will come to the triangle bar (litterally in the shape of a triangle). Stop in for a quick cocktail - it is the smallest bar I think I have ever been in, but the staff was nice and drinks were cheap (definatly a unique place). Locals very friendly to talk with there too, especially if you want to talk sports. Overall: Great place to stay, little ways from downtown, but they will shuttle you everywhere for free. Would definatly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good but needs improvements”
Reviews.Author: caesar52
Reviews.Content: Pros: The hotel is new and everything in it in modern and clean. It's in a good location however when games are playing it would be noisy. The shuttle is probably the best part of this hotel because it saves you a lot of cab fees. But coming back to the hotel sometimes it was just more convenient to take a cab back because of the scheduling. The drivers are great . The hotel restaurant and bar is surprisingly good. The fridge, microwave, and counter with additional sink is a great feature. Aveda bath products. Cons: The room with a king bed is tight especially for two people. I wanted a double room but they did not have any available. My wake up call one morning was messed up. One day I requested a shuttle and there was a misunderstanding and the driver left without me leaving me late for my appt. I took a cab and they reimbursed me with cash later which was very nice. There was a pubic hair in the bed when I checked in. A nighttime security guard had an attitude when we tried to get to the pool area when it was closed and we were not aware of the closing time.

Reviews.Title: “Visiting Seattle for a ballgame? You won't do better than this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ellipooh
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three-day excursion to Seattle for a weekend of baseball. Was a bit worried about the train whistles noted by other reviewers, but it wasn't that big of a deal after all. Just turned over and went back to sleep. The staff here was supremely helpful. Everything we needed was provided, answered, or arranged. Used the shuttle service twice without a problem (just make a reservation at the front desk), though we chose to use a taxi back each time. The hotel also arranged a Towne Car to take us back to the airport for a flat $40, as opposed to the $45 we paid for a taxi upon arrival. Used the business center to print out our boarding passes for the return flights. Our King Suite had a sleeper sofa that my niece used, and the maids made it up for her the next day. We were also provided with comfy robes, which we used on our way up to the pool. The pool was small, but great fun. We had glorious weather, and wanted to eat our lunch while sunning. No problem! Ordered burgers and cocktails downstairs, and it was delivered by the time we had changed into our suits and spread the pool towels on our chaise lounges. Even re-ordered a round or two of the cocktails. The pool was heated, but we didn't go in. There's also a good-sized hot tub. Did not visit the fitness room, partly because it looked kinda small. Our room had a mini-fridge big enough for two sandwiches, two ceasar salads, two yogurts, two waters, and four diet cokes. Microwave came in handy for instant oatmeal in the morning. Bathroom was quite large, my niece didn't even see the separate shower until she had already bathed in the tub! Bathroom also has a pocket door for the separate toilet area for extra privacy. The primary factor, of course, was the location. Exit the hotel, cross the street, and hold out your ticket. It's that easy. What a dream! You can be first in line to watch batting practice, or wait by the pool until you hear the National Anthem and just scurry over to your seat. We could actually see the baseball field from our room.

Reviews.Title: “The best if attending a ballgame”
Reviews.Author: ERRNCARI
Reviews.Content: We were in town to attend 2 games at Safe Co field...you walk across the street to the park..We had a king room..a little on the small side...but VERY CLEAN...comfortable bed...Aveda bath products..large HD flat screen TV..Quality of bath towels was fair...had to call daily for extra towels as they only give you 2 bath towels to start...but once called for they were brought to the room promptly. They do provide complimentary shuttle service to local attractions...which we decided to use on saturday...even though we had rented a car...we were dropped off near Pike Market...driver told us to call when we were ready to go back to hotel...we would be picked up at same spot....we arrived at location...called for ride...apparently a new shift was on ....we were told :they do not come near Pike market at this time of day...we were told to walk about 8 blocks away...call when we get there and then they would come...we were pressed for time as we were attending the game...we were lucky...jumped on a local bus that happened to be there...and were dropped a few blocks from hotel...we did not use shuttle again. Valet service very prompt! Not much else to do in area around stadium...nothing within in walking distance...Hotel does have a restaurant...did not try...driving back to hotel from dinner well after game was over...area is mostly deserted...Roof top pool kind of small..but again very CLEAN..We had read about the "train noises" we requested a room with a courtyard view...it was fine...I'm a very light sleeper and was not awakened by the train noises. Another great thing...it is a completely NON SMOKING hotel...HORRAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Silver Cloud”
Reviews.Author: bffchic22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take a little vacation to Seattle to do some sightseeing and catch some Mariner games even though we live about 20 minutes north of there. My husband just moved here a year and a half ago and I figured this would be a great cheaper vacation and he could become more familiar with the city. Location-This location was perfect for going to Safeco for Mariner games, you literally cross the street and are there getting your ticket scanned. Qwest field is also just across the street, so great for Seahawk and Sounder games as well. As for seeing other things, the closest area of interest is Pioneer Square which was a very doable walk, I'd say about 12 blocks. Just make sure you have some nice walking shoes on. We even walked back to the room from the downtown waterfront and it wasn't bad at all. Of course they have the shuttle though which will take you two miles within the hotel. Pick up the maps in the hotel lobby that have all the tourist destinations. Very helpful. Room-We stayed in a King room, it was smaller, what you'd expect from city hotels these days, but was comfortable for the two of us. Granite counter in the bathroom, a big tub, a wet bar with mini fridge and microwave and sink (also granite) with a very large flat screen TV and lots of free movie channels. The windows in the room opened, which was great because the room felt a little claustrophobic at night with the curtains closed (which are great for sleeping in-they completely block out the light). As far as noise, we definitely heard our fair share of trains during our five night stay, but it wasn't loud enough to wake me up once I was asleep, and I am a VERY light sleeper. Also, the windows do a great job of keeping out noise, there is a huge difference with them open and shut. Free wifi in the room too. Food-So the hotel has a restaurant on the first floor, Jimmy's on First, which we had dinner and breakfast at once. Dinner was okay, the food was just way too expensive for the quality it was. Breakfast was also expensive, I had the Sodo continental one morning and the amount of fruit was tiny, but the muffin was good. Service was great here though, the staff was always friendly. This place was never too crowded either, didn't have to wait for a table even before and after games. The Pyramid Alehouse is right across the street, we ate here twice and like it, but it's definitely bar food. If you want something fancy head up First Ave about 10 blocks to Il Terrazzo Carmine, expensive but amazing italian food. Shuttle-We used the shuttle frequently, and the shuttle drivers were always friendly even though they had to drive in hectic Seattle traffic all day long. You have to call ahead and reserve seats in the shuttle and they leave in 30 minute intervals. They do stop at 10:30PM which is kind of early, especially for the weekend so a lot of times we took the shuttle out and a cab back. Be aware that you can ride in the shuttle for a long time, for example we got picked up after walking around the city all day, got in and had to stop at five other places. We weren't counting on it taking that long and missed a dinner reservation. Service-Room was always clean, the staff was always friendly, especially at the front desk. Everyone from the waiters in the restaurant to the valet was nice and attentive. We were able to check out an hour late free of charge. No problems here. Parking-20$ valet only. Very cheap compared to the rest of the hotels in the city. All in all we really enjoyed our stay here and thought it was excellent for the price we paid (139$ a night on www.seattlesupersaver.com).

Reviews.Title: “very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: dranazy
Reviews.Content: very bad shuttle service. I came for medical conference in the convention centre. First day I waited in the subway( tunnel) and phoned the hotel to pick me up which the did in about 15 mins which is very good. The second day I phonrd and the receptionist asked me to wait in the subway for 5 mins. I waited in the same place (Subway ) but the shuttle did not show up and I phoned the hotel again after 30 mins of waiting , they told me the shuttle had just left the subway!! I am not crazy I am waiting there. They asked me to wait and it sould be coming back in 5 mins. I waited 30 min , no show , I phoned them again and every time they tell me he is coming in 5 mins. then they said no go to the subway (fast food ) on the Park street . Well,that is not were you picked me up yesterday. Howevere I went there and waited for half hour, but the shuttle did not show up. At the end I gave up and used a taxi to drive me back to the hotel. I waisted 2 hours waiting for the shuttle and it did not show up. This hotel is far away from the convention centre and dwntown and the only way to attrack costomers is to have excellent shuttle service. At night , it is noisy. I will not come to this place again. I would rather pay extra and go to a place near to the convention centre. I will move tto another hotel as soon as possible

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Return”
Reviews.Author: ruatxn
Reviews.Content: I tagged along with my husband who was on a business trip to Seattle. He had stayed here previously and knew I would love it and have no trouble keeping busy while he was working. Things that were special: Huge flat screen TV, free internet, microwave and refrigerator, rooftop hot tub, exercise facilities, restaurant, and shuttle service. I probably wouldn't have walked to the Pike Place Market alone, so having the shuttle service was great. The staff were exceptional and so helpful. The hotel was packed for opening night of the new Seattle soccer team and the place was really rocking that evening. I can't wait to go back in June.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Silver Cloud!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tacomarick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to attend the Sounders game and what a great selection for a hotel! Obviously the location is perfect as it is by both stadiums. Check in was fast and friendly. We had a suite and got assigned the 8th floor. Hotel was very clean. Probably one of the cleanest hotels I have ever seenâ€¦spotless! We will start with the room. It was very large. When you walk in to the room, there is a bar area with sink, fridge, and microwave. The bedroom was nice with a large flat screen TV, dressers, etc. There was a separate living room with a large flat screen TV, a sofa bed, and coffee table, and a safe. This living room has doors that shut so if you were sharing the room it would be great for privacy. The bathroom is the largest hotel bathroom I have ever seen. It had a full bathtub, a walk in shower, and a separate area with the toilet. The restaurant and bar in the hotel (Jimmyâ€™s on 1st) is ok. Nothing to brag about. The drink prices are higher than most I have seen in this area, so not a cheap eat! We had Lunch there which was 55.00 for 2 beers, 2 cocktails, and 2 burgers. Stillâ€¦. not a bad stop for just a quick drink if you must. This hotel is all about location. It probably wonâ€™t be the lowest price of your options but it is the most convenient. I will give you 1 WARNINGâ€¦â€¦if you donâ€™t like listening to trains, DONâ€™T stay here! No sound proof windows so the trains are only about a block away and they start blowing there whistle bright and earlyâ€¦.about 5 am. I used to live by a train station so it didnt bother me, but they could use some sound proofing to make this better for its guest. We did not use the pool, but there is a roof top heated pool and a hot tub. When we went catch a cab, one of the managers made sure we got one. I saw him with other guests as well; making sure everyone got a cab. I thought this was a nice gesture, rather than just point to the curb and let you fend for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel, Perfect Location, no taxis needed! they shuttle you!”
Reviews.Author: TNGBKF
Reviews.Content: First of all the hotel is new, so that is nice. Everything updated. Huge flat screens in the rooms, the lobby is all new, has a warm cozy fireplace. The restaurant Jimmy's downstairs looked awesome however we didn't eat there. Looked like the BEST place to go before a game. The hotel is literally across the street, and I imagine on game days, Seahawks or Mariners that place is packed with fans/clientele who like nice things. Pyramid brewery is also across the street, never made it over there but I think you can take a tour and it has a restaurant... The Best part of the hotel was the shuttle, I know you think shuttle...blah...no way, this shuttle took you everywhere you wanted to go. They had 4 drop off points but one night the driver took us right to the place we wanted to eat. Then said, call us when you are done and literally he asked me where I was and they picked us up. We only spent money on a taxi to and from the Airport. I called the hotel and they suggested a towncar and had the driver call me within 2 minutes, it was so easy. towncar was 45 dollars to hotel and 40 dollars back. Much nicer than a cab... meets you where you want, no taxi lines. Its just nicer. After reading some of the reviews we did hear those trains and yes they were loud, I'm not exactly sure how long they were making noise but we were confused on why they were going off and was it a boat, so we noticed it, but as you will see Downtown Seattle its all very port like, train like...you should expect noise. Absolutely perfect location. Will stay there everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LoveToGoAnywhere
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for four nights, coming in to see a Seahawks games. I was nervous booking here because I heard the noise from the trains could be loud, but the location could not be beat for what we needed. Upon arrival we were greeted by very friendly staff, willing to accomodate a change in our room. Our room (King Suite) was beautiful. We traveled with family who were in a standard room and I have to say that room was very spacious. The rooms were laid out well and very clean. It is a newer hotel so the decor is pleasing, and truly the housekeeping staff do an awesome job. It was a little pricey and they don't offer any kind of discount rate that we could have used. I will admit the trains, well mostly the crossings, were loud and constant but then we were facing the train crossings. The first night I hardly slept, BUT that was not enough to deter me to move from the nice room. I got used to it quick. The valet parking is quite convenient but a little expensive. They are pretty quick though. And I have to say we ate at the in-house restaurant a few times and the food was FANTASTIC. My sons loved the rooftop pool and even though it was chilly it was totally enjoyable. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very underrated!”
Reviews.Author: pinknermal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before embarking on a cruise. The customer service and rooms were exceptional. Everyone was very nice and helpful. The rooms were clean, modern and had a great view of Safeco field. And, you can't beat Aveda bath products! One great perk was the complimentary shuttle service to Downtown and the Cruise Terminals. Since this was much cheaper than other hotels in the same category it definitely gets two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Most amazing experience!!”
Reviews.Author: kbruington
Reviews.Content: Where do I even start. My husband, friends and I all stay at this hotel every time we come to Seattle for a Seahawks game. It is amazing. Clean, friendly, comfortable and the location couldn't be better. So it may be a tad bit on the expensive side but it is well worth it. On game day, we wake up, go to their restaurant/bar (Jimmy's on 1st) and get ready for the big game with a ton of other fans. Their food is great and the environment is ideal for football fans. Not only is this hotel great for games, but we are able to walk right down to Pioneer Square and to Pike Place Market. I have never written a review for a hotel but I had to for this one. I don't have a single complaint and i recommend this hotel to everyone of any and all ages!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “very nice room”
Reviews.Author: ywbird
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a great place, conveniently located. There were 4 adults and there was plenty of room. There were a few negatives. One being the $23 added charge for parking. There also was no coffee in the lobby for guests, but a restaurant on the grounds. The hotel could invest in some deep pocket sheets because the bottom sheets kept coming off and we found ourselves sleeping on the uncovered mattress. Yuk. We were in walking distance to the stadium as well as Pioneer Square; an uncomfortable walk at night though because the shuttles stopped after 10. It was very quiet and the staff were very helpful and courteous. Having a vanity/wet bar was also a plus. The room was very clean with Aveda products. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat these comfy beds!!”
Reviews.Author: tcbear
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel to go to a Mariners game on Aug. 2nd. First off the valet parking and front office personel were super nice and helpful! When we got to our room the decor was soothing and we got the view of Safeco Field that we wanted! It was probably the cleanest hotel I've ever been to. Maybe because it's newish. We didn't use the pool because we were only there one night but the location of it was really cool. We ordered room service breakfast and it arrived in 15 mins. The food was excellent and you get alot. It was probably the cheapest room service menu I've ever seen. I can't say enough about the beds!! They were so comfy that I wrote down what kind they were to see how much they would be to buy. It felt like sinking into a cloud!! The only bad bits are the street noise but we were given the option of being away from the street. The person at the front office offered us earplugs which was really thoughtful. It is also an expensive hotel to book. It is worth it for a treat but I don't think we'll be staying here everytime we go to Seattle. We will definitely be back though and highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “great stay at the silver cloud stadium”
Reviews.Author: kibero308
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel with incredible service. Shuttle was always available and took us all over Seattle! Was a little apprehensive about southern location, but no problem! Shuttle to Seattle Center within 10-15 minutes and pickup always available. Easy walk into Pioneer Square also. Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: SONNYSMOM
Reviews.Content: If you are going to a Seahawk or Mariner's game you cannot beat the location! This hotel is beautiful, clean and the staff is friendly. The pool is awesome with even more awesome views! We ordered room service and the food was even better. There is a shuttle that will take you anywhere downtown seattle and will come back for you (at reasonable hours) so if you are from seattle you need to stay here at least once, or if youare out of town then you will not regret staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Hotel With Great Stadium Access!”
Reviews.Author: cps102
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights while watching the Mariners play the Indians. Very modern hotel, with a comfy, spacious lobby. Enjoyed the exercise room with free weights and treadmills and bikes with t.v's on them. The room was very spacious, with two soft beds, and a lounge chair. The HDTV was a plus. Bathroom was a comfortable size, and plus there was a sink outside the bathroom. Jimmys on First had a decent yet expensive breakfast. Try the Breakfast Wrap. Delicious! Only bad(if you can call it bad) was that there were no stairs. Only two elevators. That meant that after the night game, there was a ten to twenty minute wait to get on the elevator. But it is fine if want to sit in the lobby and eat some complimentary candy. Great hotel for seeing Seattle Mariner games.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: none00
Reviews.Content: Positives: - Large rooms - Nice decor - Refrigerator/sink in the room - Decent restaurant (I had breakfast only) - Location was next to stadium, and a 5-minute shuttle ride to downtown (15-20 minute walk). - Service was great, I ordered a taxi and it was there immediately. Staff was nice. Negatives: - Couldn't order breakfast room service for the next day. When I called the evening before, the person said he'd stick the order on the computer, but he "hoped it wouldn't get lost" so I was worried it wouldn't go through. So I had to call the following morning to double-check. - Once when I called for a shuttle from downtown, they didn't pick up at the right spot and I saw the shuttle pass by. So I had to call again. One of the shuttle drivers wasn't esp. friendly. Overall, I liked this place. Unfortunately had a view of the inner courtyard. Pool on top was small but nice views.

Reviews.Title: “Silver Cloud Stadium - Very Nice Hotel... Near to Pioneer Square”
Reviews.Author: Smokeyham
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on TripAdvisor, and talking with people on CruiseCritic.com we booked a room in the Siver Cloud Stadium Seattle. We asked for a room with a "Courtyard" view, which is the side away from the train tracks and the baseball field. The room was quiet, especially if you have the window closed. However, your view is the rooms across the courtyard. The staff were very friendly, and the free shuttle took us to dinner at the Space Needle, and picked up again very promptly after we called. The room and the hotel are very nicely decorated in a modern style and the hotel is very comfortable. We walked to Pioneer Square from the hotel. Some homeless people sleep under a nearby overpass, and the area near the hotel is quite industrial. Not sure I would want to be walking the streets after dark, but we felt fine during daylight hours. There was no game at the adjacent baseball field when we stayed, but we wondered if the traffic and/or noise might be a problem if a game was being held. We very much enjoyed our breakfasts in the hotel's dining room. Overall, a very pleasant stay and a hotel I would like to return to.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Silver Cloud Hotel at the Stadium”
Reviews.Author: BeetleB04
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our grandaughter to stay at the Silver Cloud last weekend. We wanted to take advantage of the beautiful weather. We were greeted so warmly by Mayu at the front desk she didn't skip a beat by telling us all the amenties and things we could take advantage of during our stay. Mayu was absolutely delightful! I used to work for Marriott and really pay attention to the check-in experience along with the total experience. The hotel itself is just beautiful, and the pool on top of the roof was fantastic! The staff throughout the hotel were very nice and responsive. They really care for their property. I appreciated the staff checking on the pool every hour or so to be sure everything was perfect. We really enjoyed our stay at the Silver Cloud Stadium Hotel and can't wait to stay there again this summer. Nana, Papa and Kayla.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the Game!”
Reviews.Author: BratTee1
Reviews.Content: Great location if you are attending Mariners baseball game. Loved the hotel, room, and location. Shuttle was a huge bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for baseball/football fans!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl1269
Reviews.Content: Just came back from an overnight stay at the Silver Cloud Stadium Hotel. Our primary reason for choosing it was that we were attending a Mariner's game on Father's Day. As other reviewers have said, for this purpose the location is perfect! We were able to check in early before the 1pm game. The staff was very helpful, professional and friendly. Per front desk recommendation, we walked down to Pioneer Square for an excellent Italian dinner at Cafe Michetti's (try their signature lasagna). The free shuttle was great for seeing the other Seattle sights. Our room was spacious and clean. Beds were so comfortable and in the bathroom there was Aveda products!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: jtjtjtjtj
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively all year round and do many trips to Seattle. I was booked at the Stadium hotel through expedia corporate travel and first thing I did was go on trip advisor. I read some of the train noise complaints which made me a little hesitant, but in the defense of the train station and the hotel, the hotel is right by the train station (great for train travelers) and being that Seattle is a major city THERE IS GOING TO BE CITY NOISE i.e. busses, trains, games and lots of people. I have stayed at pretty much every hotel in or around the downtown Seattle area and find this hotel to be great. I will definately look forward to being booked again at the Silver cloud.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for baseball”
Reviews.Author: soxgal78
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights last week to see the Mariners vs. the Red Sox. You CANNOT beat this location if your primary goal is to catch baseball games. Our room, on the 5th floor, looked directly into the park, and was very nicely equipped. The hotel's newness is another big plus -- everything was clean, and while not necessarily luxurious, certainly very nice (especially the big screen TV in the room!). The hot tub was a generous size, and while we didn't go in the pool, it looked nice. One note about location -- I know a lot of people on Trip Advisor recommend staying in a more central location, downtown by the market, but this worked great for us. It was a 10-minute walk, if that, to Pioneer Square with restaurants and bars, and not even another 10 minutes to the Pike Place Market. The weather was nice, so the walks each day were really nice and enabled us to build in workouts we probably wouldn't have otherwise gotten (though there was a small workout room with some nice equipment). The hotel does have a free shuttle to downtown points, though we didn't use that. Overall, I'd highly recommend this hotel. Have fun in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DuffyMo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on an overnight to see a baseball game. Rooms are great -- new, nicely appointed, large screen digital TV. Staff was very courteous & helpful. Yes, the trains go by--we asked for the quietest room possible, and got one on the interior courtyard. We could hear the trains in the late afternoon (in our room) but that night had no problem sleeping and didn't hear a single train. Overall a great experience and I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Comfyâ€Ž”
Reviews.Author: happyzombie
Reviews.Content: Went for a quick overnighter in Seattle to attend a work function, and used the Silver Cloud as "place to sleep". Once we checked in... I didn't want to check out. Very comfy beds and good linens, decor was warm and elegant. Customer service was top notch - nice, professional and sincere. A very Nordstrom-ishy experience... and just booked a room for another stay. A little touch that made a big impact on me... they had Tully's coffee in the room. I like that they using a local product and stimulating the local economy... plus it's just darn good coffee. Keepin' it local... I love that.

Reviews.Title: “If you love listening to trains all night long, stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: krazygreekgirl
Reviews.Content: Wanted to spend the last night of our trip in the downtown area of seattle to see a Mariners game. Great views of the stadium, its right across the street. Nice clean room, unfortunately the toilet was wobbly, it's a new hotel!!!!! The worst thing was the constant trains that pass by, about every 25 minutes the whistles go off and it comes barreling through. If you don't need any sleep and want to soak up the city, great place to stay. I don't recommend this to a family, older couple or anyone who wants to sleep!!!!!!! Valet is the only choice and be prepared to spend $22 a day. I would much rather stay at the crown plaza, this silver cloud did not meet the expectations we had.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place! New Favorite Hotel Chain!”
Reviews.Author: Alatini21
Reviews.Content: Hello We went to an event at the Qwest center and this hotel was perfect! We literally walked out the doors and we were there.
